12664767.review: This game intrigued me the minute I saw it.  I would always play Zork in a huddle with friends, but I was always the only one to beat it.  This led me to be fully engrossed in text based games for years to come.  NEO Scavenger takes text heavy elements that remind me of Zork.  These come into play during the small, but quite enjoyable narrative that the player builds into their game.  The exploration and post-apocalyptic atmosphere also brought back memories of Fallout, but much more serious.  This is by no means a bad thing though because players want a very realistic experience, full of imagery, when playing a text heavy game.  This realism is also extremely prevalent during combat with so many options to choose from depending on skills, gear, etc.  However skills and gear can also heavily limit combat.  This helps the player get a feeling for their character better when role-playing a smart, but incredibly weak character.  This game gets a 9/10 from me because even though it's in my list of personal favorites, it has some faults that limit the game.  These are noticeable if too many mistakes are made on a run, lack of devotion causing boredom, or the always prevalent difficulty curve of rogue-likes.  However, I would recommend this to anyone, regardless of these minor issues, due to the shear number of appealing qualities this game holds that a vast majority of gamers, looking for a new flavored splash of adventure in their games, can enjoy.

12640009.review:
[b]Introduction:[/b] How long can you survive the post-apocalyptic wastelands of NEO Scavenger? This may be the ongoing question asked of the player by it's developers yet, I guaruntee you will be asking youself this each time you load Neo Scavenger regardless of your experience with it's unforgiving world. Even in it's early access state Neo Scavenger accomplishes what many other developers desperately attempt to attain yet fail to accompllish, an incredibly solid title built in a believable and atmospheric world, all the while laughing in it's large budget competitiors faces because there is yet more to come.

[b]Overview:[/b] Neo Scavenger is a post apocolypic turn based survival strategy game that honors such classics as Fallout and Wasteland while retaining an identity all it's own. Set in an incredibly atmospheric world, the protagonist has recently emerged from a cryo chamber without a memory as to how he got there, who he is or what state the world is in. Within seconds he recieves the answer to the latter in a very unwelcoming way. 

You soon realize that you will desperately need to scavenge this unhospitable world if you intend on your survival and will have to leave your moral bindings behind if you're to be successful. While traveling you will be encountered by an assortment of undesirables that intend on their own as well and will achieve this at any cost, whether it be thievery, murder or deception. To assure your own instead, you will need to do the same.

During your journey, you'll be presented with decisions that must be made and many times without prior knowledge of what may occurr based on your actions. You will pre-emptively strike what you deem to be

[b]Gameplay:[/b] As stated above Neo Scavenger is a turn based survival strategy game with a wide range of varying elements that will affect each new journey you begin. You will be presented with an attribute screen where you must carefully select each according to your playstyle. Each will directly affect what skills you have available in given situations that will come about so, one must choose wiseley. 

Once your travels begin you will need to manage multiple aspects in regards to your health such as hydration, hunger, restfulness, health/illness, injuries, environment temperatures, weather and more. The decisions you make will directly affect the protagonist accordingly so, one must manage these elements with confidence or otherwise you'll be swiftly presented with a message that you will assuredly see quite often, the death screen. This will come often and without warning aside from your available character management system. With that being said make sure you obsess about the details because, it's all that stands in the way of you and the grim reaper.

Aside from illness, fatigue, hunger and the like, you will of coarse encounter a variety of enemies along your journey that also as stated above intend on your demise. Combat is performed via a turn based system which, issues you an incredible assortment of options depending on your original skill/attribute selection which, I must reaffirm must be choen wisely! The options presented during combat range from hide, melee, , kick downed opponent, headbutt, sneak, ranged, retreat, offer/demand surrender, offer/accept cease fire, attempt to talk and countless other available options that are once again available depending on you attribute selection.

[b]Do I need to remind you to choose them wisely once again? I do? O.k check it out, this one's gonna hit home a bit more....Unless you carefully choose your attributes, you may within seconds contract any one of the following unpleasant status illnesses or diseases: 

Blindness, Blisters, Blue Rot, Cholera, Coughing Blood, Crippled Limb, Defoliant Exposure, Diarrhea, Gastroenteritis, Heat Stroke, Hypothermia, Hypovolemic Shock, Poisoned, Sepsis, Shock, Vomiting

Sound fun? No? Then choose wisely my friends, trust me.[/b]

You will without a doubt die and die often, yet during each playthrough you will obtain more knowledge in regards to how to survive and future strategies that come of it. 

[b]Graphics:[/b] The graphics of Neo Scavenger serve their purpose. They are in no way revolutionary and aren't intended to be, nor needed to be whatsoever. Yet if there were one weakness of Neo Scavanger this would be it. As mentioned above the graphics serve their purpose but, that in no way means that the options available should be so barron. The options available are as basic as it gets and are as folows: 

[b]Full screen, windowed, 16:9, 4:3, frame rate limiter, filter and stretch.[/b] 

Pretty uneventful to say the least and due to the graphics engine's limitations they do not scale. So expect the presentation to be a bit lackluster. Yet, once again they serve their purpose and it will not ruin your experience whatsoever. So take this section with a grain of salt because, if you're in the market for a game in this genre, graphics are the least of your worries.

[b]Sound:[/b] The music and sound effects although they may not present themselves often are perfectly crafted to create a tense and fitting atmosphere. Given the situation, the music will accompany and heighten your feeling of desperation within this incredibly depressing world. With each fade in the music will most definitely add an element that most other games cannot match. Considering so, the developers deserve an award for knowing when less is more and Neo Scavenger is a perfect example of that. The echoing sounds of the barron wilderness accompany the simplistic soundtrack design and add to a believable experience. 

[b]Story:[/b] The story although seemingly simplistic and unoriginal at first is where Neo Scavenger will surprise you at every turn and leave you wanting to know more about our most unlucky protagonist. Although at first sight it may seem minimalistic, you will be proven wrong as you progress further into this world of chaos he so sadly awoke to. The story contained in Neo Scavenger will most assuredly be a driving force behind your desire to continue multiple play sessions to discover more about what happened to this once populated land. As you can see by my vagueness, I am doing my best to protect any insight as to specific story elements which, should serve as a hint that it's most definitely there and is most definitely worthwhile. Trust me when I say, there will be many more than one occasion that will leave you in awe and in horror.   

[b]Replay Value:[/b] [u]The replay value found in Neo Scavanger is second to none[/u] and I am by no means stretching my imagination out of bounds to come to that conclusion. The very fundamentals of Neo Scavanger are built to lure the player back into it's world of dessolation, no matter how many times they've played before. With each play through, you will gain knowledge as to how your next session could possibly last longer and you will most definitely feel an urge to apply it for a "better" outcome. What will give you an even more increasing desire to launch it again is that, even after you believe you have mastered it's many facets of gameplay.....[b]you will die and die you will, often and mercilessly. Yet regardless, you will most assuredly return once again to the world of Neo Scavenger and enjoy every gut wrenching second.[/b] 

[b]Final (Early Access BETA) Review Score: [u]8.3/10[/u][/b]
Although still in Early Access form, I in no way feel it to be a hinderance to come to a determination that Neo Scavenger should find a place in the library of any gamer looking for a title that will surpass their expectations and leave them in shock that they haven't played it before. The developers at Blue Bottle Games have poured an incredible amount of love and attention into their world of solitude and despair which, I guaruntee will leave you feeling the same. If you're in the market for a survival game, give Neo Scavenger a chance!

12613737.review:
Ma dernière partie de NEO Scavenger a duré une heure et six minutes précisément. Pas en temps réel hein. En temps de jeu.

Pourtant, je m'étais fait un bon gros redneck, habitué à foutre sur la gueule de tout ce qui lui paraît belliqueux (et même de ce qui se contente de le regarder, y compris de loin), habitué à survivre dans toutes sortes d'environnements, connaissant les baies et champignons comme le fond de la pauche gauche de son jeans troué, capable de piéger n'importe quel animal à plus d'une patte ou pas loin, et capable de se servir d'une arme à feu. Le mec habitué à la brousse, à la campagne, aux vals boisés et aux plaines verdoyantes ou brunâtres quoi.

En fait... Peut-être que c'était ça le problème.

À peine sorti de ma capsule cryogénique je me suis dit que le mieux, quand on est à poil ou pas loin, amnésique, qu'on se réveille en plein milieu d'après-midi, que le ciel se couvre et que l'hiver approche, c'est de se trouver des nippes vite fait. Je veux dire, on a beau être sévèrement burné, la chemise d'hôpital c'est limite quand on a pas envie que les parties en question deviennent les parties les plus imposantes de la partie alentour.

Puis il me faudrait bien vite un truc à bouffer. Genre une poignée de baies. Ou deux écureuils. Alors quand j'ai repéré une colline pas loin, je me suis dit que c'était le bon plan. D'ici elle me gâchait la vue, mais de là-haut...

Alors j'ai fait ni une ni deux, je me suis mis en route. Vingt minutes plus tard - ça vous épate, hein - je pouvais enfin voir plus loin que le bout de mon nez. Soufflant comme un phoque en rut, j'ai avisé le bled paumé - ou plutôt ce qu'il en restait - qui se pointait pas loin en me narguant.

Alors je me suis d'autant plus bougé les fesses - que j'espérais pas trop voyantes à travers la sape bleutée qui faisait semblant de les recouvrir.

J'ai foncé, en espérant trouver un truc ou l'autre qui pourrait m'être utile : des chiffons sales, un poëlon, un vieux sac en plastique troué, n'importe quoi.

Mouais. En fait tout ce qui m'attendait, c'était des carcasses d'immeubles à peine capables de se souvenir de la fin du monde qui les avait renvoyés à l'âge de pierre y'a des siècles de ça... Tout juste une ou deux bicoques minables qui tenaient encore debout.

En désespoir de cause, je suis entré dans la première.

C'est là que j'ai vu le graal. Une armoire en état presque correct. Et qui dit armoire dit foutoir - c'est beau la poésie. Et comme chacun sait, les déchets d'un type sont pour un autre type les déchets qu'on utilise pour taper sur la gueule du lascar qui veut te piquer la godasse gauche que t'as enfin trouvé après deux semaines à passer tes soirées à enlever les échardes. 

Alors je me suis approché. Elle a pas bougé. Je l'ai empoignée. Elle a pas bronché. Je l'ai secouée. Elle a gémi. J'y ai été plus fort. Elle a failli me tomber sur la gueule.

Faute d'avoir Martell dans le ventre, je me suis mis martel en tête. J'ai poussé, tiré, grondé, hurlé... Et elle a cédé en répandant un énorme nuage de poussière qui sentait drôle. J'ai éternué. Je me suis dit que c'était le meilleur moyen de réveiller une allergie que j'ignorais, ce genre de coup foireux.

Et je suis reparti.

Fort heureusement, je n'ai mis qu'un petit quart d'heure à crever d'une hémorragie pulmonaire aiguë.

...

Vois-tu, lecteur, c'est ça tout l'attrait de NEO Scavenger. C'est violent. C'est vicieux. C'est abracadabrantesquement dégueulasse. Et c'est purement textuel.

Il ne faut pas s'y tromper : pour une fois ce sont les images qui servent de support au texte, et l'imagination qui fait le reste. Des escapades en terrain douteux aux combats marathoniens mais ô combien vivants, chaque aventure de NEO Scavenger est une historiette, une nouvelle, un roman - selon la vitesse qu'on met à se faire avoir par un monde qui décidément n'est plus fait pour les humains.

Et c'est purement jouissif.

Du moins si on aime ça. Si on aime Call of Battlefield of Honor CXIII, d'un autre côté.. Qu'est-ce qu'on fait sur la page de ce jeu ?

12608470.review:
There are so many reasons to buy this. I'm not going to bang on too much. I will say that it's games like these (and Prison Architect, Kerbal Space Program, Papers Please etc) that restore my faith in game development. You don't need AAA budgets and staff to make a game that will grip people and make them want to play. You just need gameplay, care and attention and immersion. That's what this game brings to the table, in spades. 

You're alone in the wilderness. You'll die, a lot, but it'll feel like winning. In every game you'll see something new, try things a little differently, last a little longer sometimes, die within hours at other times. Nothing is ever bland. The graphics, though basic by standards today, detract from the experience not a jot. 

You know those games where you buy them in a sale and never play them, only to try on a rainy Sunday and realise you've been playing it all week? This is such a gem. £7 is a steal. There's nothing more you need to know. Buy it now.

12466576.review:
9時間ほど遊んだ評価。
ポストアポカリプスの荒廃した世界で生き残るサバイバル・ターン制シミュレーションRPGです。
この世界で生き残っていると感じさせる作り。この作品にしかない独特の雰囲気を持っています。
アクション性が無くなって武装した車の代わりにスーパーのカートで暴走して廃墟をlootするAutoduelですかね(違いますね)。
地味なんだが、光るものを持っているゲームなんですよ。

サバイバル
生き残るためには何でも食べる。例え得体の知れない肉でも。ところで昨日見かけた死体、奇麗に消えてるな(緑髪のエレアは殺せ)。
覚えゲーでもあるので、最初は何もできずに死にまくりですが、あなたのサバイバル魂Lv(ねぇよ)が上昇するにしたがって、だんだん生き残れるようになります。
キャラメイク時に技能を追加すると、その技能で有用なアイテムを作れたり、自分の健康状態を客観的に判定したりできるので、色々試して生き残る術を学ぼう。
アイテムレシピを大量に拾えるので、作れるアイテムはかなり多いと思います。竹槍舐めんな。脅威の三段階成長だぜ(ゲームを買ってぜひ槍さんの成長を自身の目で確かめよう)。
序盤はソリとかカートとか、運搬が楽になるアイテムを拾うなり作るなりすると楽です。
それと無闇に戦闘を挑むのも超危険。こちらは素手なのに、相手はライフルの可能性もあり。遠距離での即死に注意。相手の服装などから察しよう。
なお普通のRPGのようなセーブはできません。中断のみです。死ぬとセーブデータも削除です。ローグ系です。
中盤に依頼されてとある湖の畔に行きますが、英文が長いからと言って読まないで選択肢を選ぶのは危険(ええ、私ですよ)。深入り危険。即死ゲームオーバー＝セーブデータ消え有り。ここだけ注意。余計な探検をしない。絶対約束。

ユーザーインターフェイス
Flashゲーです。よってこじんまりしたファイルサイズ。昨今のゲームとは隔世の感があります。
昔のゲームの様で操作性も良いとも思えない。寧ろ不自由。
今日も大量のアイテム欄から、アイテムを探す仕事がはじまる。
なぜか無駄に小石とかゴミクズとかも集めてしまう。投げつけるくらいしか役に立たないのに、くやしい。

12460540.review:
Un ovni videoludique. Vous vous reveillez dans un laboratoire déserté. Vous ne savez ni qui vous etes, ni ou vous etes. Mais des le depart, vous allez devoir faire des choix pour survivre. En effet, vous etes quasi a poil, et dehors, c'est pas Ibiza. La pluie, le froid, des survivants tres moyennement sympas et des mutants. Il va falloir explorer et vous debrouiller pour survivre.
La survie, c'est le coeur de ce jeu au tour par tour. Et attendez vous pour les premieres parties a mourir, encore et encore. Vous sortez du labo, vous faites quelques pas dehors, et vous mourez de froid. Ok. Vous recommencez, vous ne vous laissez pas avoir et vous recuperez de quoi faire un feu. Mais vous avez soif. Vous buvez un peu d'eau que vous trouvez en foret. Quelques tours plus tard, vous comprenez en mourrant de diarhée qu'il aurait peut etre fallu faire bouillir l'eau pour la purifier...
Neo Scavenger, c'est ça. Une suite de mort toutes plus realistes les une que les autres. Vous allez finir par apprendre, par connaitre des petites astuces pour survivre quelques tours de plus.
Le jeu est hyper realiste, autant dans ses façons de mourir que dans ses combats. Vous aurez toujours devant vous un nombre de choix enorme, a vous d'apprendre a faire ce qu'il faut. 
Par contre, petit avertissement, c'est un jeu destiné aux geeks endurcis. Graphiquement, meme avec une direction artistique sympa inspirée de Stalker et Fallout, c'est tres tres Old-school. Niveau gameplay, on ne vous prend pas par la main et il va falloir apprendre tout seul.
Mais Neo scavenger, c'est le jeu de survie le plus complet, le plus impitoyable mais aussi le plus interessant qu'il m'ait été donné d'essayer a ce jour. Si vous kiffez le old-school, l'aspect survie et les gameplay alternatif, n'hesitez pas une seconde !

12452271.review:
You can, and you [b]will[/b] die a hundered different ways. I spent hours just wandering through wilderness, trying to find something to warm myself, then I died because of unfiltered water. Another character was a survivalist, not a computer engineer type like the last one, so this time I had plenty of warmth, clean water(because I found cooking pot), food(human meat), and overall was a pretty badass. Died because of insatiable hunger for human meat. 

[b]PROS[/b]
Rich and deep game with content gradually incoming from devs, really nice post-apo rpg sim, that is a nice retro in post-apo genre.

[b]CONS[/b]
Well... it's early access, so you know what that means. If you're not fan of post-apo, original Fallout games seemed too complicated and old-fashioned, but Fallout 3 was a nice fps for you... I have bad news for ya. If you however want to support devs, so they can continue with this game, and you don't mind that you're buying half empty bottle(with a hope that it will refill later), go for it. 

Hours of fun, depth not seen in a long time, overall must have for fans of the genre.

12441814.review:
NEO Scavenger has that "special game" feeling.  By that I mean, a game where the possibilities seem limitless, and you're carried away into a new world on adventure.  The last game to do this for me was Crusader Kings 2.

It is also an example of classic "simple to learn, hard to master" design. Most of the systems (combat, crafting, movement, line of sight etc.) are very straightforward, and easy to grasp.  But put them all together, and almost everything you do is a meaningful choice that will continue to affect you throughout the game.

Also, my favourite contemporary novel is The Road, by Cormac Mccarthy, and this is as close as you are going to get to experiencing that chill when someone asks:  "What are you eating?"

Challenging at first, but once you get into it you pick up on how to play it without dying within 10 days - even then, I wouldn't take this game lightly, it will find a way to kill your character off!  Good luck out there wastelanders!

12417723.review:
I'm 27 hours in and I'm still learning a few things about this game. There's a lot of depth and possibilities.

The decision of drinking water or not might kill you a day later in the game as you die of an infection. Some enemies have guns but no ammution, so picking up a fight might either be deadly or immensively rewarding. Dogmen can hunt you down in the night while you're getting some well deserved rest and kill you in a few moves. Othertimes you desperately search for a dogman to rescue you from starvation (They drop a lot of tasty meat). Resorting to cannibalism at one point in the game might result in an impossible to satisfy desire for human flesh later on.

All the choices have consequences, many not immediately clear. This feels a bit arbritrary at first, but once you get to know the machanics you can use this to your advantage (there's a wiki that serves as a decent entry point, explaining most mechanics and providing a few tips, just make sure not to spoiler yourself). You can shoot enemys and then run away to loot their corpses later when they died of bloodloss. Or you can sneak up to sleeping enemies and hit them unconscious with a monkey wrench before they know what's going on.

There's no leveling up, no new skills to get (there's actually a way to get a few additional skills, but you don't get them regularily). Your chances of winning a fight mostly depend on your equipment, sometimes you find a loaded gun on your first day and othertimes you're desperately searching for a way to cook your water.

The art of being succesfull in NEO Scavanger lies in making the right decisions. If you have tough luck and don't get the gear you need or you're bleeding all over the place, you stay away from fights for a while. There's definitively a considerable learning curve, if you enjoy games with depth then this one is worth a look.

The interface is not always intuitive and needs some getting used to, but then again that might very well change until the game leaves beta.

I expected this to just be another casual game I spend a few hours on, but it really stands out and is loads of fun. It's very hard, but thats the way I like my games.

12403052.review:
Ein kleines, feines Spiel. Nennen wir es mal Roguelike-Cyberpunk-Endzeit-Survival. 
Für mich persönlich das beste und beeindruckendste 1-Mann-Projekt seit Banished. 
Das Spiel kombiniert den Flow eines FTL mit dem Detailreichtum und der Komplexität, die nur ein rundenbasiertes Spiel bieten kann. 
Wir wachen als Insasse einer Cryo-Anlage auf, anscheinend Jahre nach irgendeiner Apokalypse, und sind von da an auf uns allein (und unsere Skills) gestellt.
NS erfordert kaum Einarbeitungszeit, entfaltet seinen Reiz aber vor allem nach längerem Spielen, wo durchaus waschechtes Survivalfeeling aufkommt, vor allem aufgrund der Unberechenbarkeit der äußeren Umstände. Es kann also jederzeit Game Over heißen, sei es durch eine Horde Wolfsmänner, die einen im Schlaf überraschen, oder durch einen unbehandelten Schnitt im Bein, der sich Infiziert und einen mangels Antibiotikumvorrats über den Jordan befördert.. 

Neo Scavenger ist ein Flashspiel, das heißt, High-End-Grafikfetischisten werden hier eventuell nicht glücklich. 
Animationen sucht man vergeblich, die Kämpfe und Story werden textbasiert (aber extrem unterhaltsam!) abgewickelt.  
Das Artdesign finde ich persönlich sehr stilvoll, es steuert zur Atmosphäre bei, auch wenn nicht jedes Icon oder Monster hundertprozentig überzeugend aussieht.

Also, wer sich mal für ein paar Stunden zum Klickzombie verwandeln will und keine Angst vor der noch leicht sperrigen Steuerung hat:

Einfach mal die Demo ausprobieren!

12340351.review:
This title gives you tons of liberty in crafting, and doesn't frustrate you when you have to start over again and again. 
Turn-based adds intensity, especially when you're thirsty and water is a few hexes away from reach. 
Combat leaves you with total control over your end of the situation, and crafting can be augmented by one of your abilities that you choose at the start of the game. 
There's so much to explore, and I haven't really been in the same situation twice (after start game squence). 
It's not, "how do I beat this?" and more "how long will I survive?" 

With different situations, tons of options, and choice the way you survive, Neo Scavenger is fun to play over and over again.

12338072.review:
NOT: Erken Erişimden çıktıktan sonra tekrar denedim ve açıkçası hayal kırıklığına uğramadım. Siz de uğramayacaksınız :)

Hala geliştirma aşamasında olmasına rağmen eski usül oyun severlerin saatlerini hiç sıkılmadan geçirebileceği bir noktada NEO Scavenger. Hayatta kalma çabasına çok ciddi bir biçimde giriyorsunuz çünkü özellikle ilk başlarda oyun oldukça zor. Tecrübe kazandıkça oyunun zorluklarını aşmaya başlıyorsunuz ancak hiçbir zaman oyun "çocuk oyuncağı" kolaylığına gelmiyor.

Geliştirilmesi gereken noktalar elbette var, oyunun erken erişimde olduğunu unutmamak gerekiyor. Ancak yine de şöyle bir listeyle geliştirilmesi gereken şeyleri söyleyelim:

[olist]
    [*] Kullanıcı arayüzü geliştirilmeli. Bazen en basit şeyleri yaparken bile can sıkıcı derecede uğraşmanız gerekiyor. Bu en çok crafting esnasında ortaya çıkıyor.
    [*] Crafting seçeneği çok çeşitli gözükse de şu aşamada yeteri kadar eşya çeşitliliği yok. Erken erişimde olduğu için henüz eklenmeyen eşyalar olduğunu düşünebiliriz.
    [*] Oyunda eşyaları tamir etme diye bir şey yok. Dolayısıyla çok kritik eşyalar parçalandığı zaman birden bire kendinizi oyunun başlangıcına dönmüş durumda bulabiliyorsunuz. 

Sonuç olarak [u]Oyun hala erken erişimde olsa bile[/u] 8/10 veriyorum.

12335606.review:
아직 스토리라인은 거의 완성되지 않았지만, 지금으로서도 충분히 재밌는 게임
 게임 자체가 크게 복잡하진 않기에 할말이 많진 않지만, 초반 팁을 남기자면
1. 인육을 먹지마라
인육을 먹으면 모종의 정신적이상 혹은 변이에 의해 허기가 매우매우매우 빨리 떨어지고 어떤 세력들은 마을에도 들어가지 못하도록 하거나 죽이기까지 한다. 하지만, 한번 먹는다고 바로 상태이상이 걸리는 건 아니기때무네 정말 절박할 때 한번은 괜찮 을수도 있다.
2. 범용성 있는 퍼크를 고르자.
메카닉, 일레트로닉, 해킹 등의 퍼크들은 사실상 생존에는 전혀 필요없는 것들이다. 이런 것들은 물론 중간중간에 이벤트에서 쓸모가 있긴 하지만 항상 사용할수있는 밀리, 스트롱, 보타니 등의 퍼크에 비하면 효용성이 떨어진다. 그러니 처음에 안정적인 플레이를 하고싶다면 페널티퍼크에 메타볼리즘을 하나 넣고 밀리,스트롱,보타니, 터프에 이글아이나 아틀레틱 등을 입맛에 맞게 추가하자. (절대로! 불면증페널티는 넣지 말자 불면증이 생기면 한번 잠에 드는데 3~4턴이 소요되게 되는데 턴마다 내구도가 0.1~1 퍼센트 정도씩 떨어지는 시스템상 이게 반복되면  말 그대로 아이템이 갈려나가게 된다 특히, 내구도소모가 큰 운송수단은 더욱 심하다)
3. 조합에도 퍼크가 필요하다
간단하거나, 일반적인 조합들에는 퍼크가 따로 필요하지 않다.  하지만 일부 무기나 운송수단에는 특별한 퍼크가 필요할때가 있다. 밀리,레인지,메카닉 등이 이에 속하며 브로드스피어라는 쓸만한 초반무기를 위해 밀리는 거의 필수적으로 넣어야한다.(물론 밀리자체의 성능도 굉장히 좋다)
4.남자는 선빵!
이 게임의 전투에서 가장 중요한 요소는 선빵이다. 주먹이나 병쪼가리 같은걸로 때리지않는 이상 한대만 맞아도 운이 나쁘면 팔이 부러지고 피를 토하는 전투의 특성상  최대한 사정거리가 긴 무기를 장비하고, 적절한 타이밍에 태클 같은 기술로 적의 공격을 차단하는 것이 중요하다. 특히, vulnerable이 뜬 상태에서는 태클,공격 등의 성공확률이 거의 100퍼센트에 가깝게 가산되므로 적절히 이용하자. 참고로, 터프, 스트롱, 트래핑 같은 퍼크들은 추가로 사용할수있는  기술들을 추가해주니 설명등을 자세히 읽어보는 것이 좋다.

위에 있는 내용말고도 정말 중요한 꿀팁이 수두룩하게 생각나지만 여기 모두 쓸수없는 점을 양해해주시길 바라며 이만 끝내겠습니다. 추가로 친추해주시면 이것저것 알려드릴테니 친추주십쇼

12325643.review: This game is genuinely superb. There are many, many ways in which you can approach the simple task you are given - survive, and all of them are satysfying yet challenging. All the traits you get to choose while creating your character are massively useful and impactful and you can only take a few, heavily influencing how you play. What's more, the game is suprisingly fair for a rougelike - i've been killed without any chance at defending or escaping only once, while sleeping in some town ruins (which is obviously not a smart idea as these are heavily contested by looters and scavengers and i should have expected something like that to happen). The combat system is very entertaining and has some neat depth to it, at least when you are fighting on even ground. If you assault a random, starving unarmed guy with a spear there won't be any challenge, but with the same spear you can try to take on mutants, soldiers, and hunting-rifle wielding manhunters if you have the right traits and choose your moves wisely. Or you can lure those guys into some other guys, have them fight, and then move in to scavenge their stuff. Or just run and try to avoid them. Your life often depends on decisions like that, and it's quite brilliant.

12271917.review:
It is a bad sign when the demo is more fun than the main game.

NEO Scavenger has, as everyone has said, a TON of potential.  There is just so much they could do here.  Combat feels granular and staisfying, while at the same time being crazy-lethal if you're not careful.  The loot you find feels like you're struggling to survive, and the crafting system is elegant.  Character creation is simple, but offers meaningful choices.  It's got a LOT of good stuff in it.

But the main game also wants to have a story.  And that main quest line feels kinda shitty when it's next to what would make a fantastic open-world survival game.  Since death is frequent, and often from kinda unfair places, having to redo the same quests over and over is unsatisfying, to say the least.  And I'm not a hundred percent sure if the game has magic in it or not, because it sure seems like it sometimes, and that clashes with the flavor of a sci-fi wrecked earth.

Oh, the deaths.  Man.  I have died a dozen times at least from starting a game, and freezing to death before I can find shoes.  I have died because I can't find clean water, or anything to boil water in to sterilize it.  I have died from a single lucky gunshot.  I like how lethal the game can be, but I do not enjoy at all how arbitrary it feels at times.

Also, the demo thing.  The demo shows off a scavenging system where each city tile has multiple things to search.  Do you check the storage shed, which may have nothing but is pretty safe, or do you go for the high rise, where you might get jumped, but could have a lot more left over?  The main game has one thing to search per tile.  Choice : eliminated.  Just right out the window.  I cannot, in good faith, recommend a game where the main game takes AWAY choices.

12265373.review:
I'm really enjoying this game, except for a couple of details.

- Picking [Strong] [Melee] [Tough] is overpowered. If anything. ANYTHING comes within melee range and you're carrying a branch, they can kill their ass goodbye.
Got a rifle? Nevermind the bullets, just use the gun's butt and turn them into a greasy paste.

- If you get a disease, that's pretty much the end of the game. I was in an extremely profitable run, but caught dysenteria, then bloated, then the symptoms subsided. It came back not long after, then I reached "the lights" and I traded almost everything for a medikit, which couldn't do anything to save my life.

- There's an enemy that will call for reinforcements in the middle of a fight. While this is an interesting and welcome mechanic, IT DOESN'T MEAN THEY ARE CALLING MONSTERS FROM NEARBY HEXES. THEY ARE GENERATING MORE OF THEM. I got into a fight with one of them, I was hiding and using a slingshot and by the time I managed to kill the first, 4 more had shown up. By the time I killed the next, 3 more had appeared. I kept picking them off, but more kept being summoned.
Had it not been for the lack of ammo, I wonder if they would've kept spawning infinitely?

- It's turn based, but sometimes my actions are limited. Sometimes I get 5 actions per turn, sometimes, I just get 1, and I get no explanation as to why.


Like any good roguelike, it relies in random chance.

It has a very interesting crafting system that uses the skills you picked and an array of "substitute materials" in which it specifies what *kind* of item you need to craft.
"Waterproof, fireproof container" may refer to a pan or a glass bottle, "sharp edge" may be a piece of glass, a shiv, or a knife...

It's a very interesting game, which is a bit frustrating at times. If you get out of a bad fight alive, you're likely to die anyway.

Combat is turn-based with options for actions, which will vary depending on what you picked for skills. For example, picking [Tough] will allow you to headbutt an oponent sometimes, and the [Trapping] skill will let you lure an enemy into a makeshift trap.

Crafting is relatively easy. Drop the right items and skills into a grid, click the "craft" button, presto. You got yourself a new bow.

In the end, yes, it's still early access, but it's still fun, complex and interesting. I had a smile on my face when I fought a big, furry monster barehanded, took no damage, and got a "video recording of you beating the crap out of a wolf-man barehanded".
I like a game with a sense of humor.

12137828.review:
A good, fun survival game.

I used to have a much more negative review, but the patches are consistent and this has become one of my favorite games. Great updates from the developer.

Now, although my review is much more positive and this is probably one of my top indie games, I still retain my old complaints from before:

You are referred to as "Player" which kindof kills the immersion. No way toname your character, no "Phillip Kindred" or "Phillip". Just "Player".

The forced permadeath (as opposed to optional) and flaws of RNG (instances where a NPC will appear with a gun 4 feet away at Round 1, and shoot you instantly killing you, or stepping out of the Cryo Center beginning and encountering a dogman.) are also a bit stupid at times.

When will developers learn that permadeath should always be optional? This is yet another developer who forces their playerbase to play the game the way the developer himself wants- not the way that is most fun. In this way, the bad design and RNG can instantly kill you, forcing you to lose hours of work!

So for the fundamentalist "force your playstyle down their throats" mentality so many roguelike devs have, I do not recommend this game. If you don't mind this playstyle, even when it is not fun, then I definitely recommend.

Also, the game is a bit easy once you learn the way to do things or read a guide. Once you learn that Spear + always 3 feet away = Easy Win in all Combat (unless they have a gun, in which you die instantly), some of the fun is taken away. Also, trapping turns the game into EZ mode.

12058793.review:
One of Steam's best hidden gems.

The game feels like a cross between Fallout, DayZ, and even a little Project Zomboid sprinkled in. The game is really difficult yet it manages to make the experience fun. And when I say difficult I mean difficult, it's not a question of if you will die, it's more of a question WHEN will you die.

 You start in a cryo facility completely nude, save for a hospital gown. This is a problem because un-like other survival games the temperature is a very important part of the game. If you're not wearing multiple layers of shirts as well as pants and shoes you will freeze to death minutes after you start.

 The health system is really neat. It requires you to bandage each individual cut you receive. There are also injuries like broken bones that are severely crippling because of how little room you are given to carry things. The inventory system gives you a couple options: Carry it in your hands or if you have a backpack you can put it in there. Aside from that you can put things in your pants. However not even the largest backpack gives you a ton of room so every limb needs to be functioning for you to survive. There is also a range of illness that you can catch. They can be related to the cold, an infection from a cut, drinking/eating tainted water and food (respectively), and a whole host of other diseases that I've yet to experience.

TL;DR The health system is pretty intricate and requires dilligantly repairing yourself if you're going to live as well as being sanitary.

There are bandits and other monsters that prevent you from getting to comfortable. The combat in Neo Scavenger is also pretty realistic. If you fall over or get stunned it could be it for you. Or maybe not. Not everyone in this game is a blackbelt and the majority of people, including you will often stumble in combat or miss their attacks. In-fact even just charging at your enemy is a risky move becuse you could trip and open yourself up to being stomped. Guns in this game are well done and you won't become invincible if you can get one. They are decently common, however, ammo is not. You may be lucky to find maybe 6 rounds that fit into your gun. But guns are not completely uselss, though. A single bullet can end a fight. Being shot in the torso is enough to make you fall over and possibly passout, destined to either be looted and wake up naked and bleeding with your guts strewn about or to get stomped once your opponent has reached you. Bullets will also cripple/break bones so being shot in the leg or arm might not be directly fatal but the resulting infection/unability to carry things could be.

TL;DR Combat is also really realistic and fair (except for when the Bad Muthas are ganging up on you).

Crafting is also, unsurprisingly decently realistic. There isn't tons of stuff you can craft but what you can craft is realistic. For instance if you want to butcher the bandit you just killed, cook him up, and finally eat him there are several ways to do so. Unlike some games where you must have a certain tool this game allows you to use all sorts of simmilar tools to do the same thing. When you're butchering the dead bandit you can use nearly every sharp object in the game to complete this task. Crafting also will occasionally require that you have specific traits that are set up at the beggining of the game. There are a few vehicles that can be made/found and can be used to pull some of the crap you're carrying at a penalty to speed.

TL;DR There isn't much to say. Crafting is realistic but there isn't tons to make.

There is no story right now, so there's not much to say about that.


Bad stuff:

The user-interface is a bit messy.

There isn't much NPC-Player interaction other than killing eachother or NPCs acting indignant when you ask them stuff about the world.

Should you buy this game?

Yes! Even though it isn't completed and there is no story it's a fun game. The devs seem interested in completing this game so it's a safe bet that they won't abandon the project if they make bank on EA. I'm honestly surprised that more people haven't bought this game. Fans of Fallout and survival games will enjoy this game thoroughly. However, if you are not interested in games being realistic and you hate non-3D, mostly text-based, and not FPS games then don't buy this.

Rating: 9/10 Buy it.

TL;DR  It's a good game. If you're still not convinced try the demo.

There crux of this game is you wandering around the wilderness re-arraning your pack to carry the maximum amount of junk you find. Descriptive working  titles include:
"Homeless Man Shopping Cart Arrranger" 
or "Vagrant Cardboard Box Simulator"
also "Hobo with a Shotgun Plastic Bag Minmaxxer."

The idea for this this game and it's mechanic is very ingenious. The developer is very dedicated. 
The RNG element makes the skill cieling very low.

In general: Random elements exist postively in a game for two primary funtions; to create variety & to approximate the large & infinte variables of reality. While I appreciate their intended role in this game is to do precisely those two things the simple fact is their implementation is coutner-productive here. 
The simple fact is if the RNG doesn't grant you the ability to find clothes in the first 12 tiles or so your game is over. God help you should you get attacked before findin a weapon.


I really liked this game (& the developer) but I can;t in good faith reccomend it.


Also the combat is like doing the Math portion of the SATs whilst ȿhit-faced; an ardous ordeal whereupon your efforts to apply skill or reasoning only inhibit the actual deciding factor: random chance.

12008962.review:
Ok so this game is ... addictive. 

A nice post apocalyptic setup with one of the most detailed crafting systems I've ever seen. Also the game makes real use of the character skills, just like in old school RPG's - ain't got melee skill? Well, ain't gonna craft the best melee weapons, for example. 

As it is some kind of rouge like, there's no saving to be safe, it's just go for it and hope that you won't mess up, which leads to some pretty frustrating moments but also is part of the addictive character of the game. Closed the game more then one time during my 15 ingame hours but came back every time to start a new character. 

The combat system is kind of strange in the first few tries but as soon as you get the hang of it, it is really fun. It works turn based and you choose your actions as the enemies choose theirs, after that the outcome is shown in a textfield with lots of pretty brutal stuff, from arrows to the knee to wolffangs to your face. 

The graphic is not up to date, instead it is real outdated but this game is not about graphics, it's about imagination. Many encounters contain lots and lots of written text (remember Fallout 1/2 or Baldurs Gate conversations? - you won't find those conversations but massive ambient text). 

Features: 
- nice ambient text
- great crafting system, starting from making glas shards out of bottles over crafting armor from hides and furs to upgrade weapons with scopes for example
- huge bunch of neat items with degeneration
- deep skillsystem with skills giving options on encounters (but skills are chosen on character creation and can't be trained)
- big range of enemies starting from cannibal gangs over strange mutants up to paramilitary townguards (if you decide to attack them) 
- extensive character needs, from hunger and thirst over induced pain to warmth (yes, you can freeze and expect to do so often in the beginning)
-rouge like: saving only by leaving the game, a dead character stays dead but a nice little statistic when died shows some of the players accomplishments 
- one of the most stable early access games I've ever played with a range of features and stuff that outruns some released games by far 
- big, randomly created (open) world with some points of interest 
- devs active on steam forum

If you like challenging games which are more about ambient then shiny graphics, show those devs some love and give it a try (there's also a demo which I highly recommend to play to be sure this kind of game suites you).

11902560.review: Very engrossing survival game where it actually feels like you struggle to survive. You have to watch what you eat and drink, make sure you’re clothed properly, and as the title suggest, scavenge the world for supplies and materials. Every time you play it's different, and it can come down to skill and some luck. There are interesting skills that provide you with a variety of crafting options that may otherwise be unavailable, or perks such as the ability to find more loot, get better information on your medical state, or craft certain items. Pretty good story (although I haven't gotten very far because I die a lot :D) Highly recommend to anyone who is into more hardcore survival games. 11901302.review:
I really like Neo Scavenger. That's why there will be a long, LONG review on it. To Start, in even a short time of five hours, this game has left a great impression on me, from death to art style to dialogues... It's brilliant to begin with.

Gameplay: You wake up in the middle of Michigan in some sort of year, in which humanity is back to the dark ages. Heal yourself, fight, scavenge, explore, talk, DAMN. And more. Every choice is better then Mass Effect's Endings and choices. DAAAAMN. 10/10
Story/Quests: Survive in the apocalypse, find out who you are, DUN DUN DUN! Kinda cliche, but I will give the quests and random encounters credit. 7/10
Dialogues: Pretty long, and most of the lore is delivered through it, which was somewhat of a let-down. However, the dialogue was good. I'll shame it for it's lack of a Dialogue Tree thus far. 7/10
AI: The AI was great. Enemies were either cowards or knew how to fight, and their AI reflected that. With the combat system, it sets up a difficulty of COMPLEXITY, and that's either really good or bad game design. Here, it's done great. 8/10
World Design: Semi-Dynamic, beautifully designed, randomly generated. It's luck, but damn good luck. 9/10
Graphics: The game is set up in a 32-bit art style (I believe?), and the graphics look promising. Some shots of the world are detailed, even with 32 pixels. This game would have great graphics back in the 32-bit era, and good indie graphics. 8/10
Sound: Haha. None. 0/10
Music: There is a death track, thus far. Nothing special. 4/10

The verdict for NEO Scavenger is an 8.75/10. It delivers well, and it's promising, even for late Early Access. Some small tweaks, and this could easily go over a 9.

DayZ Review Gimmick: "Slept in an office, robbed and left with my plastic bag. 8.75/10, would sleep again."

11821432.review:
Dopo le oltre 60 ore di gioco, mi sento finalmente pronto a recensire questo simulatore di sopravvivenza post-apocalittica.
Inizialmente dubbioso riguardo la meccanica e il carattere survival, mi sono poi ricreduto!

[h1]Meccanica Perfetta![/h1]
Pensandoci bene, gli sviluppatori  [b]"Blue Bottle Games"[/b] non potevano concepire di meglio, il connubio tra un background ampio e una meccanica a turni era quasi obbligato!
Ciò ha permesso agli sviluppatori di [b]concentrarsi[/b] maggiormente sulla storia, [b]sui dettagli[/b], sulla realisticità, e sulla varietà, facendo di Neo Scav. un titolo che finalmente si dissocia [b]"in meglio"[/b] da molti altri Survival Game. 

Assaporata la morte per le prime 10 ore di gioco, non riuscirete a fare a meno di apprezzarlo per quello che è, [b]Un simulatore con i fiocchi![/b].

[h1]Atmosfera Ben Riuscita[/h1]
L'atmosfera è silenziosa, e ciò denota [b]l'assenza di vitalità[/b] che predomina nel mondo, l'umanità come la conoscevamo è stata distrutta, questo silenzio verrà interrotto di tanto in tanto da qualche intonazione di sottofondo o dalla pioggia che ci renderà inevitabilmente fradici dalla testa ai piedi.

Il territorio è cosparso di case e strutture distrutte e in disuso, che aspettano solo di essere esplorate da qualche fortunato sciacallo.
Quelle strade che un tempo erano protagoniste del traffico intenso sono adesso abbandonate, i bambini che giocavano nel parco, sono ormai soltanto dei vaghi ricordi, il tempo ha plasmato una nuova realtà, sin da subito a noi "sconosciuta".

Inizieremo la nostra avventura all'interno di un Laboratorio denominato [b]"Cryo Lab"[/b], e non ricorderemo nulla del nostro passato, e come unico obbiettivo la nostra sopravvivenza, e la ricerca di risposte a domande che ci porremo subito dopo esserci messi in piedi.

[h1]Sistema Skill[/h1]
Ad inizio partita si ha la possibilità di settare diverse skill iniziali, che renderanno più o meno semplice la nostra permanenza nel mondo, dalle abilità mirate a rendere [b]stealth[/b] le nostre esplorazioni, a quelle che renderanno più resistente il nostro sistema immunitario, o miglioreranno il nostro sistema di crafting.
Oltre alle skill [b]"positive"[/b], si avrà la possibilità di settare dei "malus", che incrementeranno le slot per le abilità, insomma un'operazione inversamente proporzionale, aggiungendo uno svantaggio iniziale si potrà aggiungere un'ulteriore abilità.

Il libero arbitrio fa di questa esperienza una qualcosa di unico, volete mangiare qualcosa di velenoso, andato a male? Volete cibarvi dei vostri simili?, siete convinti che esistano ancora persone oneste, o pensate che la prudenza non sia mai troppa?.. a voi la scelta, ma ricordate ogni azione ha una sua conseguenza.

[h1]Priorità Rimescolate[/h1]
Come diceva una citazione famosa, [b]"la vita ha un modo tutto suo di rimescolare le nostre priorità"[/b], ecco, le nuove priorità sono poche, ma decisive, trovare cibo, acqua, riparo, e mantenerci in salute, sono questi i parametri da tenere sott'occhio, e non bisogna sottovalutare l'idea di avventurarsi alla ricerca di qualche enclave in grado di fornirci un pasto caldo ed un letto.

I nemici però sono sempre in agguato, e questa volta non dovremmo fare i conti con soli semplici umani, o con gli zombie a cui siamo abituati, altre creature si riparano tra le fronde degli alberi e tra le città decadenti.. qualcosa sta accadendo la fuori, e solo i pezzi di giornale che troveremo di rado nel corso della nostra esplorazione riusciranno a renderci l'idea di quali trasformazioni sono in atto nel nuovo mondo.

Qualche contro effettivamente c'è, è un titolo frustrante, arriverete al punto di desiderare di vivere anche solo per una settimana, dimenticatevi i giochi in cui potete attuare strategie quasi efficaci, quì regna il caos, non esistono ripari "sempre sicuri", non esiste il modo per prevedere cosa possa accadere al turno successivo, bisogna armarsi di buona volontà e cercare ad ogni partita di far fronte ai diversi problemi che ci vengono posti.
Neo Scavenger è per molti versi un gioco di nicchia, non adatto certamente a tutti, ancor di meno a quelli che non masticano "almeno" discretamente l'inglese, vista la mancanza del supporto italiano.

Nient'altro da dire, per gli amanti delle sfide, e per gli appassionati del genere è un titolo da non perdere.

11652383.review:
This is a great game, it has story perfected, combat mastered and scavenging done in a interesting way. The start of your insigificant adventure as one of thousands of survivours is new with your main problem of navigating the menus and learning the simple things like what you need to throw in the crafting pit to make a fire. Past that things are easy to pick up on. The combat is self explainitory with its buttons being 'Kick' or 'Sprint away'. Scavenging is a odd task with you choosing what to use to improve stats of your search with 'Lighter' improving chance of finding things and lowering risk and stealthlyness.

The one problem is that there are preset things you find in the same place every time you play. One is where you find a monsterless warm sleeping bag in a car if you are freezing. You eventually just see the picture and click 'Take' as you run off with Lemming#12. The story while great is repetitive and very soon you will see your self skipping all that wonderful text some guy has lovingly made.

As negitive this note is do not mistake it as harmful ranting. If the problem(s) I pointed out are real turn offs for you don't spend the fifteen bucks. If you can ignore them like me and can see the quiality and work of this game it is worth it. [T]/

NEO Scavenger es un videojuego de rol ambientado en un universo postapocalíptico al más puro estilo Wasteland. Resulta vital conocer bien el entorno para hacer frente a sus realistas y variados combates por turnos, cuidar las necesidades básicas de Philip Kindred y estar listo para enfrentarte a las muchas criaturas y extraños que moran los misteriosos páramos del juego.

Alejándose de los clásicos mutantes y las posibilidades/recursos de Fallout, NEO Scavenger te deja suelto en un mundo difícil de comprender en el cual se te propocionan tan pocas facilidades que puede resultar más complicado que emprender una excursión tú mismo en la vida real. Es durísimo deambular por ahí sin mochila, calzado, armas y envuelto tan sólo por una bata de paciente.

Yo personalmente recomiendo buscar un par de zapatos para pies izquierdos y emprender esta enigmática y adictiva aventura.

11458857.review: Очень качественный рогалик на тему выживания в пост-апокалиптическом мире с элементами киберпанка. В игре минималистичный, но вполне понятный интерфейс. Достаточное кол-во навыков определяющих стиль игры - нельзя быть всем и сразу, но каждое умение обладает рядом полезных возможностей, сильно облегчающих жизнь. Не самая дружественная среда - игрока буквально с первых шагов заставлют позаботиться о себе, приходится буквально бомжевать - холод, голод, ранения, болезни, канибалы, мутанты, бандиты и так далее. Тут нет системы сохранений, по этому если ваш персонаж погибает, то это окончательно. Всё очень не просто, но когда освоишься, живёшь чуть дольше - готовьтесь умирать много и часто, это школа. Игра быстро отучает от жадности и наивности, она не прощает ошибок, из разряда испытаний, при этом обладает пусть скромной, но приятной атмосферой. Музыка и пиксель арт, весьма достойные, создают должный настрой и атмосферу, всевозможные события и задания, написаны интересно, достаточно оригинальная история у которой будет продолжение.

With more than 30 hours of gametime, I can happily say that this game is awesome. Only a few games have ever really left me wanting to play a little more, and this is one of them.

That being said though, this game is brutal. One minute you are killing Bad Muthas left and right and the next moment your clawed to death by a Dogman, or shot by a high powered rifle. This game never lets you have it easy, and even if you think that you can survive forever, think again. I personally tried to fight the Detroit Megacity Gaurds, it didn't end well. I also took off the bronze talisman, just to see why I had it, that didn't end to well, either.

This game is one of the best survival games I've ever played, and I will continue to play this game long into the future. If you want to buy this game, you should.

Un mélange de rogue-like et de rpg au tour par tour avec des hexagones dans une ambiance post-apo. En gros pensez Fallout 1 mais plus centré sur la survie, pensez S.T.A.L.K.E.R., pensez Wasteland. Oh et bien plus dur qu'un Fallout par exemple, ne vous attendez pas à tenir plus de 24h in-game lors de votre première partie. Faut être patient et apprendre ce qui est rentable et ce qui l'est pas en termes d'actions et de décisions.

A noter que, comme si c'était pas assez, les patchs récents ont rendu le jeu plus dur (moins de sac à dos, de médicaments et les combats sont ré-équilibrés).

Bref si vous aimez le post-apo et vous faire taper dessus par des raiders en pixels au milieu d'une forêt sombre, tabasser un mec à coup de branches pour une paire de chaussures, et passer la moitié de votre séjour dans le post-apo avec la diarrhée, vous avez un problème et vous aimerez ce jeu aussi.

11135482.review:
Эта история о том, как суровые мичиганские пацаны выживают почти в спартанских условиях пустоши. Особенно интересно становится тогда, когда полностью осознаешь правила "охоты". И причина не полюбить этот рогалик может быть только одна — вы совсем не понимаете английского языка. Других причин просто быть не может. 

[b]Плюсы:[/b]
+СЕТТИНГ
+Продвинутая система крафта
+Реалистичная система повреждений и взаимодействия персонажа с окружающим миром
+Много перков -> получаем персонажей с разной стратегией прохождения
+Огромная реиграбельность
+Где-то в глубинах леса живет существо, которое вырывает глаза заплутавшему путешественнику

[b]Минусы:[/b]
-Мало квестов / мало мест, которые можно посетить / мало торговцев
-Некоторым предметам и перкам (Electrician, Hacking) мало применения.
-Интерфейс не удобный, но можно адаптироваться
-Нужно знание английского, не intermediate конечно. Хотя бы поверхностное

[strike]Игра активно пилится-допиливается, обрастает всё большим игровым контентом, так что минусы и не минусы вовсе. Надеюсь, что в будущем игра обзаведется русификатором[/strike]

Персонаж проснулся в криогенной камере. Камера была разбита, а в главном помещении раздался шум. Что-то приближалось. Быстро. Это был, сильно раненный, оборотень. Сказать, что он был удивлен присутствием человека — ничего не сказать. Нет времени на раздумья. Выпад и голова оборотня встретилась с дверным косяком, он издал необузданный крик, который пронесся по всему крио-центру. Туша упала у ног. Вне здания очень холодно, а одет только в больничный халат и на шее болтается какой-то бронзовый амулет. Обратив внимание на обстановку, в глаза бросилось то, что вокруг много стёкол. Освежевав тушу, первым попавшимся под руку здоровенным осколком стекла, смастерил себе меховую накидку из шкуры. А что? Зато не холодно. По пути пришлось подбирать всё, что попадётся под руку, дабы соорудить себе ночлег и хотя бы какие-то орудия для защиты. Сделал копьё и лук, заточил стрелы. Охотился на оленей, ловил белок. Жарил их на костре, чем привлёк внимание рейдеров. Рейдеры прервали трапезу, пришлось убегать. Их самих что-то утащило в лес. Проголодался. Пришлось есть все ягоды, которые попадались в поле зрения. Начало мутить, закружилась голова. Началась сильная диарея. Обгадил весь лес! Истощенный и изнеможенный забрел в самую чащу. Потерял сознание. Проснувшись обнаружил, что был обчищен полностью. Бронзовый амулет тоже утащили. Потом внезапный грохот и чащу леса ослепило бело-синим цветом. Бесформенный мрак появился из ниоткуда, в центре он источал огненно-желтый цвет. Его белое, как мел лицо уставилось и быстро приближалось. Слишком поздно бежать, начался сильный кашель кровью...

11131484.review: Un bon jeu comme on en fait plus, un mélange des premiers fallout et de stalker, des graphismes minimalistes qui laissent place  a une vraie histoire. Boire une gorgée d eau dans une flaque est jouer à la roulette russe, marcher pieds nus et dormir dehors sous la pluie nous conduira au cercueil enfin on aura pas ce luxe en mourra gelé sur place laissant notre corps à la merci des affamés...  Les différentes approches possibles en fait un jeu bien plus complet que la plupart des survival-games au graphisme "hi-tech".

11089212.review:
This game is a great survival RPG for anyone who wants an unforgiving, challenging, and heavily replayable game. The gameplay is very enjoyable, and I find it interesting how realistic this game is. The developers really have put in time to make sure that true human necessities are represented, such as food, a warm place to sleep, something to drink, and a means of protecting yourself. You're almost guaranteed to not do well on your first playthrough, but that's one of the best things about the game. As you keep playing, you learn more and more about what you need to do and what to look for & avoid, and you constantly get better at it. If you've played Don't Starve, you'll see similar gameplay aspects in NEO Scavenger.

If you're a fan of the original Fallout games, if you like survival games, or if you like truly tough games that take time and effort to succeed at, you'll surely enjoy this game.

Each time you die you learn what you did wrong and survive even longer. Who knows, maybe you'll live long enough to see the snow ;D

10935150.review:
NEO Scavenger. Když píši tyhle řádky, tak jsem toho ve hře ještě moc nenahrál a hra je stále ve vývoji i přesto si dovolím tvrdit, že se jedná o NEJLEPŠÍ POST-APO SURVIVAL simulátor jaký jsem kdy hrál a to i přes to, jak vypadá. Jedná se totiž o hexagonovou tahovou hru u které si jistě každý vzpomene na staré textové hry.

Ve hře je tolik možností už teď, že nemá cenu vše rozebírat, ve zkratce si můžete volit skilly a schopnosti, které mají opravdu vliv na zážitek ze hry (tzn.: nejsou tam jen na okrasu, a třeba pokud nezvolíte "Trapping" nemůžete ze zvířete dostat kůži a získat tak teplé oblečení hned od začátku) a tak si volíte vlastní styl hraní, vyrábíte spousty věcí, bojujete, prohledáváte, nocujete, obchodujete, opravdu je toho spousty a podle mě by si tuhle hru měl vyzkoušet úplně každý kdo má rád "přežívačky".

Proto hru všem doporučuji a nemohu se dočkat až bude dokončená! Dal bych jí 90%, uvidíme jestli se to změní až bude vydaná se vším všudy.

10932475.review:
Neo Scavenger, ahh, my old friend which i have returned to more than garry's mod...

Right, down to business.

So, you begin the game with picked skills slumped over a cyro-sleep tube, with a wolffman coming towards you. What do you do? Hide? Lock the door? Dump another cyrotube so that someother poor sod gets eaten?

When you survive that (and it's impossible not to) you are thrown into the big, bad world of post apocalyptic Michigan. I've battled canabalistic mobsters over a bottle of whiskey, I've died of Cholera because I failed to purify my water, I've done a whole lotta things, but won't go into much detail due to the spoilers that would arise.

Pros:
Great gameplay
Graphics fit well
Regular updates (Thanks Dan!)
It just went into the finished game (Early Acess person)
Lots of tools, bags, boxes, weapons and general stuff
Steam trading cards (If that's something you judge by)
Brilliant crafting system (the sun can be used for example)
Tetris-like inventory that matches weight with space (Yes, I'm looking at you Skyrim/Fallout)
Well-done combat system
Full range of medical conditions, and more are being added. (Blisters, cuts, lacerations, bruises, punctures, abrasions, burns, etc)
Thoughtful (albiet incredibly frustrating) storyline

Cons:

There are only two things I dislike:
The first is the random encounters. Now that they are much more frequent, they play a bigger role in the game, however attempting to do the morally dubious option, nearly always gets you injured (not killed, but injuries very quickly can become fatal.) 

Two cases: You enter an arcade where there has been a slaughter by the fanatically religious Blue Frogs. A man croakes to you to help him. Helping him, gives you small items, but useful, bottles of water, lighter etc. Rifling through his pockets results in anything from a bruise to a cut due to him fighting back. Next example: A pimp comes up to show off a prositute, you can walk off, but because I wanted to see what happens, I asked if I could hire her. Two scenes later and i'm stabbed and bleeding out in a ruined apartment because suddenly my guy thought it was a bad idea and the pimp got angry at him.

Lastly is the storyline, which ofter results in banishments, deaths, or injuries: You mut find out about your past, and to find the man who was paying for your cryosleep, you must visit two completley random locations, to get two completley random items, then have picked the almost useless hacking skill if you don't want to get chucked out of the city. And don't even get me started on the time I got run over and died due to not tipping at a cafe/eatery/diner type thing.

All in all, NEO scavenger is a great game, with an active development and well thought out gameplay. Ten out of ten, buy this game already!

10820176.review:
+ Versatile crafting system where recipes are discovered either by random tinkering or by little "scraps of paper" found in the world.
+ Multiple skills which have an important impact on playstyle. Whether combat is even worth it or not depends a lot on your skills - avoidance is very often the better option.
+ Crafting is actually very important and useful.
+ Very few, if any, items which act as a be-all-end-all.
+ Except for early hypothermia, if you die, it was most likely a bad decision on your part. Often, the connection between cause and effect is extremely convoluted and indirect.
+ Multiple survival factors which have to be controlled in unique ways.
+ Interesting combat system that doesn't make the player the automatic most likely victor.

- Player has frozen to death. Player has frozen to death. Player has frozen to death. Player has frozen to death. Player has frozen to death. Player has frozen to death. Player has frozen to death. Player has frozen to death.(read: the early stages of the game are aggravating.)
- No substantial SFX or graphics.
- Scavenging, while an important feature, is lacking in depth. It will hopefully see some kind of minigame attached later in the beta.

92 / 100

10780376.review:
NEO Scavenger is a rogue-like survival game that was originally made in Flash.
You control a character with amnesia or a version of memory loss, it is your job to make sure you survive in the vast post-apocalyptic landscape filled with mutants and raiders. The game involves turn-based combat and crafting which both give the game that unique gameplay style that makes it stand out amongst other titles. (May not sound like it, but it really is different)

The game is hard, I really do mean hard. The rogue-like genre means that when you die or lose in game you will need to restart from the beginning, it also means that each map is procedurally generated and so there will never be the same items or NPC's in a single location. With the difficulty aside the game is really fun with a lot of replayability, there is no real storyline yet but it will be soon implemented according to the dev.

At the time of writing this review it is still in the beta stage of development and also in Early Access, from what I have seen and played it is one of the few Early Access games that haven't disappointed me.

10730829.review:
This is the most realistic survival game I have ever played, and due to the current stance of the industry I doubt anything will beat it for a very long time.

The game mechanics are ridiculously realistic. Seriously, sometimes I die within the first 2 minutes of playing. Each and every single move you take could be your last, and this is not a game that becomes easy over time as you learn how to play it. This is a true survival game unlike any other.

The mechanics are very balanced, and you have to do many things to survive. The crafting and inventory system is very nice, as it allows for a lot of customisation. Do not let the graphics of this game fool you, as the gameplay is what matters here. I personally really like the art style and retro feel to the game anyway.

If you really want to know how much time the developer spent on making this game, here is an example: If you try and put minature items such as pebbles into a shopping cart, it won't work because in real life the pebbles would fall through the wire framing of the cart. Despite this being a very minor and insignificant example, it goes to show you how much the developer cares about the game.

10559508.review:
The concept of this game is great, the detail put into the crafting is excellent.  And that's about the limit of its positive qualities.  It's biggest and most glaring flaw is the 'erase your save upon death' feature.  That's right boys and girls, they PURPOSEFULLY designed this game so that if you die once, if, oh say, you cant find better clothing within 8 hours, or you encounter a creature, or you take off the silly little necklace you start with, you will die, and whatever progress you have made is erased.  

The idea of a hardcore mode has it place, but in a game that offers such a chance for exploration, that offers such a detailed crafting grid, the FORCED, non optional hardcore mode is a terrible idea.  Want to play the game to explore, see the world they created?  Too bad.  You either blitz the story, or die once to either bad luck or bad enemy design, and poof, congratulations, all your time and effort has been destroyed, and you get to do it all over again.  I suppose this is probably someones idea of fun, but it isn't mine.  I honestly regret making this purchase.  If you're looking for a GOOD survival style game, get Project Zomboid.

10495058.review:
To state it simply as I can, there is no way that I can do enough to recommend [b]NEO Scavenger[/b] as highly as it deserves.  In the Kentucky Derby of the rather numerous games (a few of which have or are solid enough to merit at least some serious note) in this generally broad set of the Post-Apocalyptic/Survival genre of the current/modern PC scene, [b]NEO Scavenger[/b] is a Thoroughbred Champion of the most uncomplicated sort.  

The thundering hooves of the race set the pace out of the gate, nearly beating a tattoo on your ribs from within the moment you find yourself thawed and unceremoniously deposited into a world that appears to not only have been blasted and scarred by the now typical arsenal of Post-Apocalyptica, but also one haunted by Werewolf-like monsters -among a number of others-  that are both imminently fatal, but also understated in a way that for my own part recalls the same sort of creeping, crawling, truly psychological horror upon my initial encounters with some of Lovecraft's more authentically gripping horrors.  

With a pedigree of the caliber that [b]NEO Scavenger[/b] boasts for itself in my ever so discerning gaming tastes, the more atypical or "monstrous and supernatural" of the associations piercing my own memory and stretching all the way back to 1931 and the horror that rose from Y'ha-nthlei to consume and squat over Innsmouth as the Dagon's Deep Ones.  The second major thread is likely more easily expected and certainly open to being related to by a (vastly) wider audience in the sense of the overall and yet still growing popularity of the genre, this association springs forward over (the next two and three) centuries, bathed in the near incandescence of the white washed mediocrity of the just shy of unending faux 1950s Apple Pie-Americana and all consuming oceans of nuclear fire and equally inescapable Fallout.  

In contrast to the almost stark bleakness that Lovecraft instilled in me at times - without being overtly apocalyptic; whereas Fallout inspired and from time to time continues to inspire the notion that humanity might well resist and rise again on the dark side of whatever Great Catastrophe it happens to be this time.  And it is certainly a blend of these personal, half-imagined (and again, doubly personalized) inspirations and senses of direction for my gaming imagination that are invoked upon finding my way out into [b]NEO Scavenger's[/b] wide-open Michigan, a great American state that it would seem will take a little more than a single puny Apocalypse to wipe off the map altogether.

I imagine that aside from being a logical decision for a one-man marching band, along with/and cost-effective from the angle of overhead and production costs, the old-school vibe and streamlined [i]everything[/i] go a great ways in the direction of encouraging the individual player to engage the game in a way that other, more modern examples do not and cannot allow for.  Specifically, there aren't so many details, so many aspects of the experience predetermined by hard-coded and visualized default automatically and inescapably included in the Scavenging experience from the mouse click on.

The Crafting System is a standout aspect of the Gameplay Mechanics for [b]NEO Scavenger[/b], which speaks to a bit of that aforementioned logic - it being pretty pointless to spend an entire game scavenging for junk that doesn't, or can't be combined with something to do or become anything useful.  The type and variety of that junk you'll be so happily scavenging is at a fair balance at the moment - though more melee and/or ranged (re: improvised DMRs/battle rifles) weapons of any stripe and variety, as well as pretty much any new items at all will always make me happy.  The combat system is similarly uncomplicated and crisp, though perhaps taking a game session or two for many of the more fast-paced FPS-twitchy gamers of the here and now.

It's these invitations to the individual imagination that - along with the perfectly applied Game Mechanics- are the most easy and obvious examples of the true genius you can find here.  Or, to restate it again in final summary, there's so much about [b]NEO Scavenger[/b] that will allow the gamer to become as immersed in and rewarded by their experience as the breadth, depth and staying power of their imagination will allow.

10367067.review:
Nunca matar a un hombre para robarle un par de botas había sido tan satisfactorio, ni tan difícil.

Empiezas tan solo con una bata cutre de hospital y tendrás que salir a un mundo post-apocalíptico a intentar sobrevivir, a partir de ahí empieza la cuenta atrás hasta tu muerte, porque en este juego morir es lo normal. 
Se tienen en cuenta muchos atributos como el cansancio, el hambre, la sed, y el estado físico (dolor, heridas, enfermedad, pérdida de sangre...) así que tendrás que buscar (o crearte) sitios seguros para dormir, habrá que tener cuidado de no dejar heridas abiertas sin curar (o curadas malamente) para que no se infecten o para no desangrarte, y por supuesto no comas alimentos venenosos o en mal estado porque sufrirás.

Básicamente hay dos elementos principales en el juego: 
1 - Buscar: buscar cualquier tipo de material, incluyendo alimentos. Dependiendo de dónde busques encontrarás diferentes cosas (alimentos en bosques, armas en ciudades...)
2 - Crafting: con todos los materiales que encuentras podrás crear otros nuevos. Habrá desde cosas sencillas como encender un fuego hasta otras más complejas como creación de armas de diferentes tipos.

Según la suerte que tengas con estos dos elementos podrás sobrevivir durante más tiempo o menos, por ejemplo encontrar un arma de fuego (con munición) te ayudará en los combates, pero si no eres capaz de encenderte un fuego te morirás de frío, así que debes elegir sabiamente tus habilidades y tener en cuenta que cualquier decisión que tomes podría ser la última.

10231558.review:
This game does an excellent job of combining roguelike elements (map randomization, loot randomization, permadeath) with a post-apocalyptic environment.  As a parent of two children, it's rare when I spend 24 hours (at the time of writing this review) on a single game.

Although I am still working my way through the narrative, I am finding it very interesting and it reminds me of my early days of computing where the story is told using text with minimal pictures, allowing you to form your own image of what's going on.  I didn't realize I had missed that until I played this game.  It's great.

In other games (Elder Scrolls, Terraria) I have not been a huge fan of crafting, but I'm finding that in this game I really enjoy it.  I've found most of the basic recipes, but I have a feeling some more will appear as I progress through the narrative.  This game has changed my opinion of crafting in games and got me looking into others (Project Zomboid, for example).

As this game is still in beta, I think some user interface improvements would be helpful going forward.  Some examples include the ability to easily combine stacks of items such as pills, without removing them from the pill bottles, and the ability to consume stacks of items such as berries (rather than eating one at a time).  Recipes could be streamlined as well if there were a way to chain them together.  For example, harvest meat, create fire, cook/cure meat.  Or create fire, sterilize water.  These are minor annoyances and don't detract from the enjoyment of the game, but could greatly streamline things.

Overall, I really like this game.  As someone who didn't care for rogue likes or crafting games in the past, this game has really opened my eyes.  I don't know how to explain other than I play the game just for the fun of the game.  Rather than playing to progress the story as in a traditional RPG.  Many times, I don't even pursue the story; I just scavenge and try to get the best equipment and camping gear possible.  Lastly, I'm also excited to see what the recently implemented modding ability will bring.

10224721.review: This game is actualyl surprisingly good! It's like a mix of Civilization, with DayZ~ plus it's still in Alpha, i think which means that a lot more is going to be added. Already has modding support even though i havn't used it :) worth the price!

10223284.review:
Neo scavenger is a game that allows you to select a number of skills and disabilities, such as being good at lockpicking, identifying herbs and mushrooms, or being shortsighted, fragile, or weak.

You then go on a journey across a hexagonal map, scavenging buildings and combatting various gruesomes, crafting items and completing quests.

Think of it as a small scale S.T.A.L.K.E.R.

I find it fun for short bursts.

Protip - Tracking is a great skill - it lets you make a high quality piece of clothing from the first enemy you encounter - If you fight it that is.

10207187.review:
จะเกิดอะไรขึ้นถาหากว่าคุณได้ลืมตาขึ้นมาในโลกที่ล่มสลาย เหล่าผู้รอดชีวิต สัตว์กลายพันธุ์ ที่พร้อมจะทำให้คุณตกที่นั่งลำบากได้เสมอ คุณจะเอาชีวิตรอดได้นานขนาดไหน เพื่อค้นหาความจริงว่าคุณคือใคร

ตัวเกมนั้นถูกสร้างโดยทีมงาน Blue Bottle Games เป็นแนว survival turn--base ในธีมโลกในอนาคตอันใกล้ ที่บ้านเมืองล่มสลายจากสงครามและภัยธรรมชาติ ขนาดเกมนั้นเล็กมากๆ (50 mb) และยังใช้โปรแกรม flash player ในการเล่นอีกด้วย

ตัวเอกของเราได้ฟื้นจากการจำศีลในห้องทดลองเป็นเวลายาวนาน คุณคือผู้กำหนดชะตาชีวิตของเขา เริ่มแรกผู้เล่นจะเลือกความสามารถของตนเองได้ตามต้องการ 4 สถานะแรก(เช่น แข็งแรง วิ่งเร็ว หิวช้า) แต่ถ้าอยากเพิ่มความสามารถนอกเหนือจาก 4 สถานะแล้ว ผู้เล่นจำเป็นจะต้องนำสถานะที่เป็นผลเสียให้กับตัวเองเข้าไป จึงจะเพิ่มความสามารถได้ (สถานะเสียกับดีจะต้องไม่หักล้างกัน)

เกมนี้ ไม่มีความยากง่าย ขึ้นอยู่กับการตัดสินใจของผู้เล่น เริ่มเกมนั้น ผู้เล่นเองจะยังไม่มีอะไรเลย นอกจากเสื้อคนไข้บางๆ กับการตัดสินใจว่าจะสู้กับสัตวกลายพันธุ์(dogman) หรือจะหนีออกไป เราถูกขีดเส้นตายไว้ที่ประมาณ 8-9 ชั่วโมง เพราะเสื้อที่เราไม่มีใส่ อาจทำให้หนาวตายในที่สุด (ฝนก็ตกบ่อยซะด้วย) (ผมรอดได้สูงสุด 22.38 ชั่วโมง ว่างๆก็มาลองเล่นดูนะครับ)

ด้วยความที่เป็น turn-base ทำให้เราต้องวางแผนอยู่ตลอดเวลาว่าจะไปไหน จะหาของยังไง จะสร้างของชิ้นไหน จะสู้กับศัตรูในแบบไหน บอกให้ศัตรูยอมแพ้ หรือทำร้ายเขาจนปางตาย การนอนหลับ อาจทำให้คุณถูกทำร้ายได้ง่ายดายจากศัตรู คุณคือคนกำหนดเองทุกอย่าง 

โรคภัยไข้เจ็บ อาการเจ็บป่วย นั้นสำคัญกับเกมนี้มาก คุณอาจจะตายได้ง่ายๆถ้าคุณแค่นำเศษผ้าสกปรกๆมาพันแขนคุณไว้ การใส่เสื้อยืดกางเกงยีนส์ไม่สามารถทำให้คุณอุ่นได้ การโจมตีด้วยอาวุธประชิดเพียง 2 - 3 ครั้งอาจทำให้แขนคุณหักหรือขาดไปเลย

ในส่วนขององค์ประกอบอื่นๆทำออกมาได้ดี โดยเฉพาะเสียงดนตรีที่คอยกดดันตลอดเวลา ภาพประกอบในเกมก็ดูใช้ได้เลยทีเดียว
