10173268.review:
So, basically you have lost all your memory after waking up from Cryo Sleep, in an abandoned Cryo Facility in an extremely cold Michigan.
You then start looting stuff, most importantly clothes for warmth before the night falls and you freeze to death, then food, and then a weapon to have atleast small chances of winning a fight you might get into.

The game has a very good story line, not gonna spoil it.

What I like on this game the most, is that it's simple and complex at the same time.
That means it's mainly hex 'n' text based, you will not encounter any animations besides rain and snow (if you make it that far, that is.)
And you can simply just go around loot stuff and use them against people and for you.
But you can also do alot more, like for smallest examples, boil river / lake / marsh water to sterilize it instead of directly drinking it and risking infections and illnesses.
Or you could take a branch and sharpen it with a knife, or add sharp objects into it to make it a broad spear.
The combat also, pretty simple yet complex.
You CAN win a fight by simply repeatedly pushing the attack button, but you can also win a fight by playing much more tactically, luring people into traps, using the environment to your help etc, and win that fight even better without any injuries.
You can either follow the storyline, finding out who you are / were, or you can just do open world play and survive in the harsh environment.

It might look like a simple game at first, but I promise you that there's A WHOLE LOT MORE into this.

The crafting system is VERY deep, and you can craft QUITE alot, I'm playing it since a long time (before steam release) and still haven't had every single crafted item in the game.

It has a wiki with alot of hints and tips about everything in the game.

Also, for modders:
It has modding support, VERY easy at that.
To add just about anything, that is encounters, items, combat moves etc.. you just have to add some new lines into the .xml file, and the forum includes alot of documentation on how to do that.

I do recommend this game because it's simply awesome and has a very long and big replayability rate.
Also, did I mention the map gets randomized every time you play (besides the story hexes) ?

10167309.review: Definately one of the better roguelike games available on steam.

10166060.review:
I now got nearly 24 hours of this game on the clock. And i really like the simplicity of the design and the general way the game throws stuff randomly at you. It's not Disneyland and at least you do not need to worry about the occasional troll like in DayZ or else. 
BUT.
Here goes:
   - The GUI is sometimes cumbersome to control. For example you need to switch from the crafting screen to the movement screen to end your turn with a click of the mouse. Or you need to get send to the movement screen after waking up. need to go to the sleeping screen to sleep again. I see that the pattern of view fields on the left and action fields on the right is partially implemented. but could use some rework to make it more smooth. 
And the inventory moves stuff around, when consumed, that just confuses.
   - You do not really see how many moves you got left and how much moves something takes. As a person, you normally have a good feeling how long you take for what task and plan accordingly.
   - The important part, realism: 
   - Infections do not kill you within hours 
(i had no fights, no injuries and i get killed by an infection of a wound recieved in a fight, just a few turns back.. That got treated with sterile cloths and antibiotica... yeah no). 
  - Cured meat lasts far longer than two days tops. Iregularly smoke fish without salt and fish is far more prone to go bad than regular meat, and it lasts longer.
  - The water consumption is way over the top, for the climate displayed. Heck you can't even sleep a night through without waking up by thirst in the middle of darkness!

I'd like to see the points above as an encouragement to the dev to make a good game great.
As i said, i got no problems with the randomness of the opponents or that you can get killed by a lucky blow of your opponent. Shit happens ! 
Random loot, fine by that. 
Selling Prices at the Junkyard. Maybe Tannine Tea is a bit much, but thats a small thing. 
Corn-A-Cola too much effect? Nope! I've seen people collapse after they fell into a sugar and caffein low with red bull. 

I am unsure about the watermechanic of the game . Normally water from flee flowing runnels and streams is generally safe to consume to an extend (i mean the setting is clearly not in the tropics). Best but slowest is water gathered after rain or from dew, then again we do not know how much the rain is polluted in the game. 

All over all a good game, considering the pricetag and that it is early access. I played less hours on Titanfall, and that was quite hyped.

10150469.review:
This hex-based, turn-based, post-apocolyptic, survival exploration game is quite unique and fun. The gameplay largely centers around exploring abandoned cities searching for useful items and shelter. One of the best features of the game is the level of detail in everything, every item serves a purpose and every decision has its pros and cons. The combat is extremely brutal in spite of being text based, as the descriptions are very specific and make you think about what exactly you have done; eg 'You kick the enemy breaking their ribs and punctured their lung, they bleed to death.' There are a lot of hazards you can succumb to, such as temperature, sickness, bleeding and starvation.

Overall I reccomend this game to anyone who likes challenging tactical turn based games, particularly permadeath roguelike style ones.

10103655.review:
The unique style of NEO Scavenger is not that unique as they want you to believe. It's very reminiscient of the original point and click games such as Fallout and Baldur's Gate with even similar typed "cells" you interact with. Now, that's not necessarily a bad thing. In this case it works great for the way the game wants you to play. Finding resources and survival are obviously key to this type of game and they don't fail on that note.

However, the combat seems way too strange. Albiet, if you have a weapon (melee or ranged) the fights are much easier to succeed; my encounters with fights early game with no weapons lead in instant failure. I don't know many people in an apocalyptic setting that can take getting punched, tackled, kicked, and mercilessly harrassed for very long. Yet the survivors you fight, have exceptional durability. You can kick a person 10+ times on the ground and they still somehow manage to stand up, punch you and break your shoulderblade. After a 12 minute fight with the first random stranger outside ends, I freeze to death and all of that was a waste of nothing. 

I understand this game is not to be taken lightly and stroll through it, but I haven't made it far past the first main objective. I have frozen to death at least eight or so times because of how the world is roughly randomized. Sometimes you're lucky and fight resources to keep you alive and buildings to sleep in so you can make it there, but other times, you will freeze to death before you can find a shack. 

No matter how unsettling this sounds, I truly have been enjoying myself everytime I play. Simply because the story has already captivated me into wanting to hear more on the story. As well as enjoying the game, minus the few listed, I have had no complications with playing this game and I'm excited to see any possible additions and hoping for better luck in my coming ventures.

10074861.review:
요즘같이 3D그래픽이 난무하는시대 그 그래픽또한 고퀄로 변해가고 있지만 2D도 충분한 매력이 있다. 이게임은 2D의 정점이라고 하기엔 턱없이 부족하지만 게임의 재미를 살리는 데엔 충분하다. 약간 조잡스러운 인터페이스가 흠이긴 하지만, 그 외에 게임적 요소들은 충분히 흥미를 끌만하다. 더욱이나 아직 얼리엑세스인 베타버전이고 더욱더 컨텐츠가 추가되고 스토리가 완성이 된다면 충분히 수작으로 탄생이 될듯하다. 멀티는 지원하지 않지만, 이 게임특성상 싱글플레이가 딱 맞아 보인다. 생존게임이라는 흥미성과 함께 플레이어를 괴롭히는 스트레인져와 밴딧 더불어 괴물들까지. 긴장을 풀 만하면 찾아오는 이놈들은 충분히 게임의 재미를 보장한다. 물론 어느정도 파밍이 된다면 어느시기 까지 다소 안전하게 플레이는 가능하지만 말이다. 이 게임이 더 마음에 드는건 상점에서 이 게임이 얼리액세스로써 어느정도 게임이 완성되었는지를 한 눈에 알아보기쉽게 그래프로 표시해 놨다는것이다. 현재 베타라고 할정도로 완성이 되어있고 좀 더 가다듬으면 완성이 될만한 완성도의 게임이다.

앞으로도 꽤나 발전가능성이 보이며, 또한 모드까지 지원한다고 하니 단순히 메인스토리를 깨고 샌드박스 생존게임을 하며 무한 플레이하는것뿐만아니라 다양한 유저들의 모드와 스토리를 즐길수 있어보여 매우 만족한다.

도진의 네오 스캐빈져 평가점수는?

10점만점에 7.5점!

다소 취향을 탈수있는 그래픽과 생존게임장르이기 때문에 약간 점수가 낮아졌지만 얼리앳세스게임과 인디게임치고 굉장한 수작이라고 평가된다. 한글로 나오지 않는게 매우 안탁깝지만(됬다면 +1점은 됬을탠데!)후에 정식발매된다면 다시 한번 평가를 작성해보도록 하겠다.!

이 게임은 양심적인 가격도 상당히 마음에 든다!

10074535.review: Neo scavanger Is a awsome game period, Dont let the screen shots or videos fool you this game is great its crazy in depth and the plot is tried and true, the game is so amazing that I could cut down a tree limb and combine it with a tarp I had found to make a lean to, or take a pot and fire to boil my water to make it safe to drink, These are just a small sample of the variety of things you can create, it almost feels like if you can think it you can do it, Very few games other than project zomboid (also an amazing game) seem to be able to give you this sense of depth, The game is played by reading text and moving your character in a grid overworld kinda like final fantasy tactics, I will admit from screenshots I said this game will suck and its not for me....Boy was I wrong just get the demo play it and Im sure you will buy it, This is the only game I have ever played that I killed a man just for his left boot, This game is hard it wants you to die, but each time you do you learn from it and the next time you will go a little farther this style of gameplay is very rewarding do yourself a favor and pick up neo scavanger, In its current early access state I give it a 9/10 amazing.

10049487.review: This game provides hours of fun. I say go in blind, so that its a learning experience as you go in. Note: You will die....a lot. Between Dogmen, bandits, and slow painful diarrhea death in the forest. But it's really rewarding to learn what to do and watch as you start survivng for longer and longer. Worth the money.

10045723.review:
Addictive, "one more turn" mentality ensue's.  Neo is a rougelike zombie survival, heavy with crafting inventory managment, with the beginnings of a story just now appearing.  The game is pretty much a open worldthat you get started in with next to nothing. Based on your skills you choose at the beginning of the game you will have access to different weapons and items with varity usefulness.  The game has lots of potential and in the time that I have been playing it has made great improvments.

Highly recomended.

10044450.review: A very good Unreal World -like game!

10037700.review:
If you like hardcore RPGs and value gameplay over graphics, you should definitely give this a try. Very fun and extremely addictive. It reminds me quite a bit of the original Fallout games, although it plays quite differently. There are some bugs and balance issues, but for an under-dev game that's apparently being created by one man, it's fairly polished.

NOTE: Try to demo to get a feeling for the gameplay, but note that the demo lacks a lot of features and has a number of bugs that are already fixed in the paid early release version.

10033347.review: This game is like a combination of Fallout 1, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. and Project Zomboid. It has a strong emphasis on day to day survival, this game will screw you up if you don't know what you're doing. If you like survival games or any of the above games, and don't mind the graphics, you should certainly consider trying this title. (There's a free demo available on the website of the developer)

10032044.review:
Basically dark souls little 2.5d brother, this game has it all: scavenging, a fighting system i've never seen, moral choices, a story you can follow or just dodge and continue your survival, a good atmosphere, etc. i'vev enjoyed it a lot so far, though i died quite a lot of times, but once you get the hand of it (diseases, combat, scavenging) its a pretty neat game.
a must buy for scavenger/post-apocaliptic game type lovers

10031202.review: Neo Scavenger is a unique game thats been in development a long time. If you're a fan of survival strategy games, or just like playing great games, this is the game for you. Its the kind of game you can play whether you care about stories or not, you can play the story to the currents end, and roam around, just seeing how long you can survive, or just skip to surviving right away. Both are equally fun. In a sense, the game is a little like Dwarf Fortress: Adventure Mode, where "dying is fun!," and where its fun to bumble around and fuck yourself over countless times. However, just like Adventure Mode, its annoying in the sense that if you don't know what you're doing, you're liable to shoot yourself in the foot right off the bat, however the learning curse is pretty low, so you won't have to worry about that for long, espically if you watch videos on Youtube or read forums.

10020958.review: It's hard out there for a pimp.

10020918.review:
You either live long enough to see the source of the lights to the South-East, or you die from hunger, dehydration, hypothermia, or by a single attack from another human you couldn't sneak away from in the first few days.

While you have a choice of skills at the start, the majority of the game is strongly effected by luck.  Luck of loot found, luck of places to camp in, luck during encouters; a single fluke can kill you.  With permadeath a constant fear, one must be wise about every action taken.

It's a good turn-based survival, almost table-top-like game.  Your real entertainment will be seeing how long you can survive in this post-apocalypse world.  You have to use your imagination for most of it, but to those who enjoy roguelikes or table-top strategy games will find this a good buy.

There's a demo; if you're even the slightest bit curious, TRY IT.  (there are things omitted from the demo, but it'll give you a very good idea of how to play the game)

10006221.review: A great Survival Simulator. Be alive and buy it if you look for a survival Game!

9995861.review:
As a post apocylipic survival game, Neo Scavenger serves as a (probably) pleasent diversion from the typical zombie survival genre. In this game you are faced not only enemies from both the earth and beyond, but also with realistic factors to your person that may prove your undoing if neglected, and you are also faced with perma death.

Combat in this game makes up with it's lack of action with it's in depth desicion system that controls how you approach situations, which also comes to play in miscelanious events that fall outside of regular gameplay. These 'events' will grant you with better outcomes if you select the right perks for your character at the beginning the game. Select the wrong ones during character creation, however, then you might as well let the dogmen (not to be confused with werewolves) eat you where you stand.

The cruel realism of the game forces you to think, making this game fun to play and giving it it's strategic element. And now that modding is becoming available, I personally cannot wait for all the crazy - or scary - ideas the comunity can grant for this game!

9994266.review: This game exceeds all the survival post-apocalyptic games I have ever played. It truly gives a new meaning to survival where finding a can of soup is life and death. That person you just killed even though he didn't have any form of defending himself has clothing and shoes for you to survive longer in the cold nights. It is always different every time I play especially with the permadeath feature installed, that is what I like the most about it. You don't just have the ability to reload and play it differently. When you die, that is really it and you'll just have to play it again and that is the fun part because nothing is ever the same!

9976428.review:
самый пиздатый Пост-Апокалипсис с блэджэк  и шлюхами.
Самый реалистичный и интересный.Рандомные карты, можно угрожать и оружием и сдаваться в плен и много другое.Графо дрочеры идут мимо.Кто любит апокалипсис вам в эту игру. 10/10

9974834.review: This is a very interesting game with great looking art, an AMAZING system for just about everything, and it's also the only game I have ever even heard of where you can die from cholera, blue rot, being gored to death by a robotic saber tooth tiger, being chopped to bits by a robot, acute bleeding in the lungs, traumatic head injury, and numerous other diseases and medical conditions. The game IS very challenging, and not for those who give up easily (or at least those who can't edit files nudge nudge wink wink), but it is also VERY rewarding to play, both to see the complex beauty of the game and to see the world of post-apocalyptic Michigan.

9973791.review:
After a particularly long 4-hour session (of multiple deaths) and many other playthroughs, I'm going to give a review of this game, and it's pretty harsh.

Neo Scavenger is a game that has possiblity emanating from its mechanics. The writing is beautiful and manages to capture most any scenario that you're put into. Generally, it prides itself on being a survival, inventory-managing (think Deus Ex) roguelike that is incredibly unforgiving. Maybe a little too unforgiving.

Generally, when I lose a roguelike or a game in general, it'd be nice to have some idea of what I was doing /wrong/. I don't have that sense while playing Neo Scavenger. Most every playthrough, I think I am playing at the top of my game, as best as possible. Enemies can randomly hit you in the head with their fist and instantly kill you, even if you're geared up to the max. Unless you get ridiculously lucky, the cold of the environment WILL kill you. Eating the wrong things WILL kill you. If you got unlucky and didn't find a town, the cold or wolves or zombies or bandits WILL kill you.

It has stopped being fun to play. The UI is there. The mechanics are all there. The combat is thrilling. The art is there, the writing is there, and dammit I want this game to be so much more than it actually is. If you really want a hyper-realistic survival game, especially one as complicated as this one, then I can recommend it wholeheartedly. But if you're looking for an enjoyable, frantic gaming experience (as so many other survival games hope to achieve), Neo Scavenger unfortunately is far, far too luck-based to give any sense of accomplishment.

In addition, over the 5 months I stopped playing, the "skill ceiling" or "endgame" has gotten no higher or larger as far as I can tell. A legendary melee weapon (the crowbar) is handed out basically for free, the warmest clothing can be found in nearly every building, and one corpse's food can sustain you forever, as can the numerous woods, rivers etc. If you don't start out with certain skills (botany comes to mind) then you'll be stuck relying on finding towns to survive. and you CAN'T get new skills aside from the implants that I've never seen.

Overall, I think that with a bit of patching Neo Scavenger could be a great, renowned game. It's not that it needs polish; it needs content, and it needs a difficulty that scales directly with how skilled you are, and skill should /matter/ more than it does.

9936944.review:
It is not often you find a roguelike where all the tables are even from the start. Where the skill of you, the player, makes all the difference, and not simply how much time you have spent making your character stronger. That won't happen in this game. On top of all of that, and no matter how much gear you find, how good a weapon you have, how sharp your skills have become. There will always be something that can kill you.

As day breaks, I spot hiding in the nearby woods, a creature that is both man and beast. To my luck, I find the target unawares, at rest. Creeping in closer, spear in hand, I get in close, so close, hoping that the beast will not notice. The rain works in my favor here, and before the beast has a chance to act, I pull back and plunge my spear deep into the creatures eye socket. Your life, can end just as easily.

After the battle, I take out my trusty pocketknife and get to work, pulling the flesh from the bone, and using my skills to keep the pelt in one piece. Trophy in hand, I sling the pelt over my shoulders. Both as proof of my skills in combat, but also, I will not freeze. Not tonight.

9925391.review:
You can die of diarrhea
11/10 would diarrhea again


Well, I did not expect 232 people to find my review helpful. That probably means I need to improve it. I mean, diarrhea is only one of the many things in this game. 

NEO Scavenger is a pretty tough survival game. Unlike most other survival games, this one is more strategic, and isn't first/third/ResidentEvil camera. It's like a hex-turn-based board game. 

When you begin a new game in NEO Scavenger, you're greeted with a page. Basically, you can pick traits to help you in your adventure (Botany lets you see if a certain mushroom is safe to eat, Lockpicking lets you break into locked buildings, etc.). There's also Flaws. Things like Insomniac will make sleeping more difficulty, and Metabolism will require you to eat more. Of course, some Flaws have positives. Metabolism, for instance, slightly increases healing. 

It's possible to encounter friendly NPC's, or ones that want to punch you until you recieve a concussion and die. Of course, there's a way to protect yourself from hostile NPC's (or you just want to kill friendly NPC's). There's a variety of weapons. It could be a Butcher Knife, a Shotgun, a bunch of pebbles (for the daring), and a Crowbar. There's obviously more, but those are a few.
Speaking of NPC's, there's strange critters roaming around the world of NEO Scavenger. Ever wanted to encounter a DogMan? Or this creepy humanoid-like thing that wants eyes? It's in this game, and the latter is pretty creepy.

NEO Scavenger has random encounters. You can encounter things like: a broken-down car with a sleeping bed inside, a tank with people inside, a dog, or some other stuff (that can be a little screwed up). There's also some set locations in the game. The game is randomized, but there are a few areas that are always there. For example, a large city, and a strange house. There's a few more, but you can look for those (or just Google them).

NEO Scavenger has a looting feature. You can scavenge abandoned houses, buildings, and more. You might find worthless junk (like the almighty pebbles), or you might find a backpack, or even a gun! There's also left/right shoes. 

The quest for shoes begins begins as soon as you begin. Walking barefoot is no fun, and neither is freezing! Finding shoes and warm clothing is important at the beginning. You game will be cut short if you don't find these items ASAP.

Well, there's probably a bunch of other stuff I may have forgotten to mention, but if I remember, I will surely add it in.
Do get this game. There's also a demo, so try that out, too.

A fantastic game, a true retro feel. If you are looking for something with graphics this isnt the game. If you are looking to kill a bandit with a sharpend stick to loot him for a boot a crummy tshirt and a quarter full lighter then this is your game. The perma death system makes you take fewer risks (you know, actually trying to survive) The skill system is pretty good, though at the time of this review isnt fully implemented. The only thing i have against this game is if you use a cleaner like CC cleaner it will wipe your saved game. SO keep that in mind, you dont want to wipe your flash cache when playing this one. 9/10, would play again...if i wernt still keeping it in a window while i work.

Update 8/30/14 The game has been updated to have more enemies, more items, more story. Every addition is very cool. I've never seen an unfinished game that added things so quickly and so smoothly. They are really on adding content. This is fast becoming one of my favorite games of all time. Best 10 bucks i ever spent.

So. This game. I love this game. A lot. It's simple and addicting. Goal is simple, survive.
Getting to the goal is the hard part, because you will die. It's the only constant in this world.
Well...that and taxes but in post-apocalyptica I don't think taxes are a thing anymore.

9778671.review:
(EDIT: Fixed a terrible typo that changed the meaning of one sentence into the very opposite.)

Even during its beta stage NEO Scavenger feels like a completed and a released game. It can be intense (provided you have the imagination), it can be (actually it WILL be) evil and it can be forgiving (for a brief second before you run into a pack of dogmen who rip you apart).

NEO is also ridiculously cheap for it's value. Of course, I'm not trying to encourage a higher price, I'm just thanking Daniel for his reasonable pricing. (Take that Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes)

I can't recommend this enough. After getting the game I sunk a ridiculous amount of time into it in a single weekend. I recommend starting off completely blind. No wikis. No gameplay videos. Just jump in. After dying horribly a few times, you can begin checking a few things out from the wiki. OH and I URGE you to read all the messages at the bottom of the screen during combat (you can click the box to expand). Then just let your imagination fly and get all the horribly violent moments carved deep into your brains. If your imagination is anything like mine, you're gonna find this game to be one of the most ruthlessly violent games you've played and it doesn't even graphically show you any of the scenes.

Now, I understand this is not a game for everyone. If you don't enjoy reading a lot of text, that is not a reason to stay away. You don't have to read any of it. But if you don't enjoy slow paced, the original Fallout-like games with survival and tension, you might as well stay away. But if you know someone who likes that kind of stuff, please, tell them about NEO Scavenger.

9776173.review:
Neo Scavenger is perfect for the hardcore Post Apocalyptic fan. If you've ever wanted a gritty, brutal depiction of survival when everything hits the fan. Continually updated, well made game, with a great artwork, riveting descriptions of important structures, and each playthrough is always different. With alittle imagination, the basic graphics and be ignored and you can become enthralled in your own personal story of survival.

TLDR MODE
PROS:
Alot of content for a fair price
Continually updated
Extremely Dynamic Gameplay
Realistic feel and setting (for the most part)

CONS:
Extremely Difficult for beginners,
Basic graphics (Who really cares about that?)
Sometimes frustrating.

9768757.review:
"Do not get caught with your pants down. Pants? You start the game with no pants at all!"
Oh dear...

The game offers a good demo - http://bluebottlegames.com/main/node/21 so there's no cost to trying it out. The UI is bad, but the lure of trying again, and trying to learn and make progress is there, and it is strong. You will almost certainly not be impressed the first time you play it, but give it a second or third chance. It plays differently and presents a very interesting and realistic, though grim and unfair world to explore.

I have enjoyed a lot of games that focus on sneaking and hiding but few made simple hiding as desperate or exciting as NEO Scavenger. You try desperatly to cover your tracks and hide before you end your turn. But that slows your progress... Hunger, thirst and the bitter cold force you to take risks. Plus you need stuff to survive, but unfortunatly for you, so do other drifters and vagabonds.

Combat is unbelivably intense. UI clunkiness robs us of the full experience at least the first few times, then it becomes less about the menus and more about your, so far well going game, about to be ruined by a stranger. Even a weaker oponent can cause harm, wounds, and can alert other threats and lead them to you. There is no time pressure of any kind during combat, yet it allways feels dangerous or even desperate. You have to have some degree of faith that your choices will play out in your favor. They usually lead to your death until you learn more about the game. It's very much about survival, staying safe, luring other threats into traps or each other... and scavenging. Remains, food, parts. You're allways scavenging and the overall aim is to set yourself up for survival.

First impressions count for a lot, and this game is Early Access which hurts it somewhat, esp. the lack of variety in a game where you die and start over so much. NEO Scavenger attempts to offer a niche gameplay experience, a bit like FTL or Papers, Please, where gameplay and style are different enough to make it something unique. Unfortunatly, it's current Early Access status makes it clumsier and less satisfying to play, and promises such as "This isn't even my final form!" usually end up dissapointing. However, this could be a very good game and trying the demo wont cost you a thing.

Recommended for fans of turn based combat, realism, crafting, survival, adventures, Fallout, and games where graphics take a back seat to gameplay, strategy and athmosphere.

9767457.review:
Quite possibly one of the best games I have played in the recent months. I got it with a bundle, but NEO Scavenger is honestly worth more than its asking price. It may only be flash, but don't let that deter you. It has one of the most realistic systems I have encountered. The developer is an active member of his own community, and that is very difficult to find these days with titles of this magnitude.

I'm not very picky with what I play, but I am picky with what I play often. Since I got it, I have been playing this game every day, dieing every day, and starting anew every day. You die, a lot. But for some reason I always come back to start again, most times directly after the fact. This isn't like Dark Souls difficult, where if you die, you can just load up a save from right before it. No. When you die, you die. You have to start all over again.

Each time you start, it is somehow an entirely new experience every time. The maps are randomized, NPC loadouts are randomized, loot and scavenging opportunities are randomized. The only things that don't change are the story, fixed encounters, and your inevitable death in these unforgiving wastes. You can spend hours building up the best loot and getting the best weapons and armor, just to get kicked in the head in your sleep, and have to start all over again. For some reason I have come to enjoy this.

The crafting system is remarkable, to say the least. Much more involved than that of Minecraft or Terraria. You are able to use the skills you chose at the start of the game to create new and different items than you could without. Being able to craft items that can possibly save you from a fight with a Dogman or a Blue Frog, keep you fed for a day, or drink clean water, can give you some sense of security. Until you fall asleep and get kicked in the head.

This game is not for those that want an easy game, that they can win every opportunity they get. You can be fully armored and have a shotgun in one hand and a crowbar in the other and pulverize the person you're fighting, just to have them throw a rock at you and die of internal bleeding a couple turns later. This game is unforgiving, and even when you're the biggest badass of the wastes... you can still die by eating some berries.

I love this game. Plain and simple.

If you are unsure about whether to buy it, i suggest getting the Demo for it and giving it a whirl. 10/10 Love it

Знаете, что вы сделаете, очнувшись в камере холодного сна где-то в постапокалиптической Америке? Вы сдохнете.
А потом ещё. И ещё. Изнемогая от жажды, вы выпьете некипячёную воду и через пару дней умрёте в муках и говне. Вы пожалеете бандита, а он сбегает за подмогой и размозжит вам голову разводным ключом. Вы порежетесь, обшаривая разрушенный офис, ваш бинт придёт в негодность, а остальные бинты выкрал ночью полудикий гидроцефал, и, заработав сепсис, вы будете в панике искать антибиотики, наткнётесь на собакочеловека, который наградит вас парочкой новых порезов, и, убежав от него, вы умрёте от потери крови.
Вы сдохнете. И эта игра великолепна.
А если она вам не понравится, я разобью вам голову прикладом. У меня всё равно нет патронов.

9760833.review: Even though it's still in Early Access, Neo Scavenger succeeded in keeping me busy for multiple hours in a row. At this moment, the only goal is to survive as long as possible. You'll be confronted with hunger, thirst, other scavengers who'll hunt you down and so on. I can really recommend it for those who like survival games (as I do myself).

9760803.review:
Desafiante, e por isso, incrível, para aqueles que gostam de jogos com temática pós-apocalíptica, é mais do que recomendado. Possui mecânicas simples, mas que funcionam muito bem, o combate é bem estratégico, sair só batendo no seu oponente, mesmo com uma ótima arma, pode ser uma péssima escolha; o sistema de crafting também é muito bom, e com algumas peculiaridades que só jogando para perceber. Além disso, é um ótimo RPG, primeiro no papel do jogador interpretando o personagem, em cada gameplay você pode ser um personagem diferente, pois as skills (e sua interpretação do seu personagem) permitem isso. Além disso, durante o jogo até parece que você está jogando um RPG de mesa, pois o jogo, que nao tem muitas imagens dos cenários, descreve eles com uma riqueza de detalhes, o que alguns personagens estão fazendo, o que seu personagem está vendo e sentindo. E conforme dito, cada gameplay muda, então o fator replay é alto, até porque cada gameplay você descobre algo diferente, uma localidade nova, aprende a crafta algo que vai te ajudar, entre outras coisas. 

O jogo vale cada centavo gasto, muito imersivo e intenso!!

9760786.review: This game is the most realistic and BRUTAL game i have played.This game really makes u feel like u are out in the wilderness fighting for survival as u go through hunger,thirst,Freezing temperatures,treating ur wounds from shootouts or fights in the wild and wild animals that may or may not harm you + humanoids and humans who also may or may not be friendly.Diseases in this game play a nice role in this as u wonder whether the berry u are about to eat is going to poison u and kill u and so on.One of the most realistic game i have played in a while 9/10

9757183.review:
Played when I bought it, since then I have been trying to survive, fought loads of bandits and looters, scavenging equipment. In the first hours, my character would die from starvation or dehydration or either get killed because for some reason Dogman(s) love to hunt me down. However on the second day I used the crafting page, and started to read some of the information at the wiki. This went on until I succeeded making the right character with the necessary traits to fortify my base and create alarm systems, and as well as foraging and hunting and making traps, producing clothing and distilling and sterilizing water, and also going beyond to even cure cooked meat with salt(ash). 

So far I think this game is realy really what I always wanted from an apocalyptic role-playing game. There is freedom of choice, and also a pretty large map and simulates even in a small platform a deep experience for anyone, who want to feel like role-playing in this large area infested with looters and bandits, predators, and hidden quests.

http://store.steampowered.com/app/248860

I would really recommend you to try this game out, and also help the developers to finish the game and add more content into it. I am really impressed on how much they have managed to squeeze into this game. In my books the developers have scored 10/10 in gameplay and also the healing/medical system and the metabolism and other addictions and features which mimic the human body is outstandingly simulated. Perhaps even one of the first games which has gone so far as to bring in the human metabolism system into a game.

9753259.review:
Roguelike游戏神作，中文名为末日拾荒者。上手难，但是一旦上手会爱不释手。
贴吧：http://tieba.baidu.com/f?kw=%C4%A9%C8%D5%CA%B0%BB%C4%D5%DF&from=prin
QQ讨论群： 256781712

游戏的各项指数，从上往下依次是：
饥饿，口渴，疲劳，负重，舒适度（和温度有关），室外温度，受伤情况（疼痛，感染和流血）
这个游戏的基本生存原则，就是保持以上指标都是在正常范围，任一项的指标进入危险状态，都会导致游戏的结束。为了保持游戏的正常进行，请参考以下建议：

饥饿：食物来源有3种：干粮，植物和动物。干粮，通过搜索建筑有一定得概率可以获得，基本只能救急，因为数量非常少。植物：野外可以采集到莓和蘑菇。记住，如果没有选择植物学这个技能的话，莓只保留蓝/黑莓，蘑菇全都放弃，因为其他的植物都有一定的概率会导致感染。肉类：通过猎杀动物（人类）来获得，肉腐败的非常快，最好是立即将肉制成烤肉（需要火和短棍）或者腌熏肉（需要2个灰，火和短棍）。普通烤肉能够缓解口渴，腌熏肉会导致口渴。

口渴：野外的生水不能直接喝，直接喝有概率会导致感染，所有的水源必须消毒后饮用。有3种获取干净安全水源的方法：测水器，净水片和将水烧开。测水器，非常稀少，而且需要有电池才能使用。净水片，普通水加上净水片就能获得干净的水，因为数量较少，请在紧急的时候才使用。烧水：最重要也是最基础的获得安全饮用水的方法，需要火源，水和防火防水的器皿（锅子，空罐子或者玻璃瓶）。平时记得收集一些塑料的空瓶子，可以用来储存干净的水。推荐透明的塑料瓶，很容易区分有水还是没水。（绿色的塑料瓶辨别起来略吃力，尤其你有十几个瓶子的情况下）

疲劳：疲劳度通过睡眠来消除。睡眠涉及一个舒服，安全的问题。尽量在建筑物中睡眠。可以通过帐篷（2个短棒+长线+8*10的防水布），睡袋来提高睡眠休息的效果。为了避免有人在睡眠的时候袭击你，需要制作一些发声报警器，方法非常简单，任何容器（比如药瓶，塑料水瓶）+小物件（石头，玻璃，子弹，药片等）+短线。4个发声报警器，能最大的程度的让你防备敌人的入侵。最后，记得离开休息地的时候，将发声报警器带走，同时将帐篷拆掉一起带走，以便以后再次使用。

负重：除了双手可以携带物品外，游戏中提供了很多方式可以让你携带更多的物品。一般有以下三种情况：有口袋的衣物裤子，背包，载物器具。衣服裤子：衣服有一件夹克是有口袋的，不过必须脱了皮毛大衣才能装卸物件，尽量存放不常用的东西。裤子，最好的裤子有9格存物空间。背包：基本是2种，塑料袋和登山包。塑料袋的优点是不适用的时候可以折叠起来只占用一个，还可以作为引火物。登山包的优点是容积大，是游戏中期的标准装备。双手也可以拿包，也就是说不考虑载物器具的情况下，一个人可以携带最多3个登山包或塑料袋。注意大多数的东西都是有重量的，过多携带东西会让玩家移动缓慢，疲劳加快。载物器具：指可以放在车辆选项中的，可以载物的容器，一共有6种。托盘，非常容易找到的红色的托盘，严重影响移动力。拉线托盘，托盘+中等线构成，游戏早期非常有用。超市手推车上半截，由于无法和中等线组合，请尽早替换。旧式雪橇，需要机械修理能力，材料是2个长物件（比如大树枝），4个中物件（比如短棍）和12个中等线。超市购物车，需要机械修理能力才能制作（探索有小概率可以找到），如果想自己制作需要注意收集多功能工具组和至少4个轮子。记住，所有组合的材料中，耐久度最低的一项，将会是组合后购物车的耐久度。另外超市购物车的储存主体是有缝隙的，无法存放小物件。手推纸盒车（探索小概率获得），终极载物车辆，同样需要机械修理，多功能工具组和轮子等物件来组装。

舒适度和室外温度：很当前的环境和身上的衣物有关。简而言之，和身上的穿着以及是否有加热物有关。如果有狩猎技能，可以在处理猎物的时候获得皮毛，其中狗人的皮毛直接可以当大衣穿。过热的话，就脱几件衣服吧。

受伤情况：疼痛，感染和流血。任何一种情况，如果不处理的话，最终都可能导致玩家死亡。疼痛，只有靠吃止痛片了，游戏中有两种止痛药物，在探索的过程中随机获得。感染，需要使用盘尼西林，高级医疗器（稀少）。流血，用干净的布条包裹伤口，干净布条的获得方式是火源+器皿+脏布+水。如果选择医疗技能，能够直接看到三种状态的具体情况，并且在游戏一开始，获得一个急救箱。急救箱里会有止痛片，盘尼西林和干净的布。

9750165.review:
I got this game in a humble bundle, didn't know what to expect from it, and was really pleasantly surprised! This is a very fun game. Difficult starting up (There is literally zero hand-holding, game throws you in with no instructions whatsoever and you have to figure out what everything is and does as you go) and you will die many, many times, but you'll have fun doing it.

possible cons: niche, slow paced, very much trial and error, death by the whim of rng, probably would get old after a while (as all games do)

I enjoy it a lot, but maybe watch a video or two before getting it as I'm sure it's not for everyone. Still, definitely recommend, very pleased with it.

9746727.review:
That game is now in my favorite games ever played.

It's one of those rare games that you get a feeling of accomplishment when you get some valuable loot and manage to keep it for a long period of time. Even if you die and have to start back from the cryo lab and the beginning is always the same, it's really easy to have a completly different experience while you play. You will never encounter the same enemy during your first travel to one place and you will really need luck to survive some obstacles (for example, someone steal all your stuff while you sleep, including your clothes. The amount luck you'll need to survive that is really really big).

You know that you've progressed in this game when you look back at the main event that happened during your journey. From when you left that cryo lab with only a hospital gown with you and when you just killed 5 dogman with your rifle and your compound bow.

Speaking of combat, this is one of the games where you feel more cruel when you kill someone than in a FPS game, and you dont even see it happen! It's just click and hope to read something that is good for you! Even if you are not reading a book each time you use an attack, you'll feel very cruel when you'll read that he died by lung bleeding, so you basically caused him to drown in his own blood.

Anyway, go buy this game now! Its really worth it!

15/10

9728519.review:
I spent a lot of time looking for a good scavenging/crafting/surviving experience. Since stalker: call of pripyat I felt kind of left in the bench, but Neo scavenger totaly have potential for it! It feels like actual surviving, having to find food, clothes, shelter, water, tools, weapons, decide if you run or fight in an encounter, craft things etc. every mistakes can be paid the high price, the global experience is impressively convincing!

The game's really hard tho, I keep dying in so many different ways, which is great as surviving shouldn't be easy, but the permadeath makes it really hard on the player, you barely start to get some good stuffs and die to start from the beghining again. It's really frustrating, but the difficulty of the game make it so deliciously painful ^^

The game is still on developement so criticizing is probably prematured, but i'd like to signal that the rarity and price of ammunitions makes it unworthy to equip anything else than melee weapons, also (maybe it's a bug) when the cart broke i lost all my stuffs inside on many occasions, which doesn't make sens, as if the cart broke the stuffs shouldn't just disapear and be on the ground for me to save what i can... And last thing, the food/water mechanism isn't really logic, as you'll starve almost as fast as you'll get dehydrated, eating 50kg of berries will feed you for barely a few hours and they're pretty hard to find when you need them.

Here's a few thing I'd love to see implemented/improved, hopefully devs would read it (who knows ^^) and find some indeas interesting, also maybe some things i suggest here are allready in the game/planed and I haven't found out yet, sorry if it happen:

-Ability to cancel last action, as sometime i click on the wrong square or make mistakes while crafting.

-Fixing the strarvation system: human body can last over 40 days without food, it doesn't make sense to die from starvation after barely 2 days. Maybe splitting "well fed" with "hungry" and "bulk", where "hungry" would affect your action points, fight capability, scavenging ability etc. While "bulk" would be your global "well fed" status, going from overweight (which inflict handicap), to anorexic which make "hunger" constantly low and starvation deadly. Also the meat spoils really fast, i'm not sure if it's unrealistic but why not some ways to make it last longer, like an hermetic bag, lunch boxes, thermal backpack or something.

-The combat interface is pretty hard to understand, sometime i just get attacked out of nowhere while sleeping (which is pretty cool), but the guy turns out to be badly stuffed and wreck me out in couple hits, leaving me no other option than crie while watching my character die in horrible pain. Maybe something signaling the global risk of the oponent and/or chances of successfull attacks, dodges, escapes etc. Just so we know if we can try a fight or just drop all our shits out and run the hell away.

-How can't a medic + botanic find some antidotes in forests? I keep dying from poisoning without having any chance of reaching the clinic. Also, items in general lacks a description of their effects as well as statuses leave you wondering how to fix them i'd like to have a hint of what everything does or need to be fixed (for ex: antibiotics: can heal X, or dissentry: can be healed with X).

-When crafting, have a picture of each craftable item in the recipes list, this would ease a lot the recipe's browsing.

-Pliz, just pliz, more ammunitions, I gave up using any weapon as i take hours to find only 3 bullets, and allways for the one weapon you don't have, i love to shoot things, but in a week of playing I had the chance to do so about 3 times only.

-I would LOVE to be able to fix items, for example taking parts of one gun to fix another gun, it makes a lot of sense and have been seen in many crafting/rogue-like games (such as fallout or 7days to die), I really love that feature as you don't waste good finds (like guns, backpacks, carts etc...) just because you allready have one that's in a barely better condition.

-More shopz! there is only one shop, and it's near town which mean if you want to farm cash, buy ammunitions, buy food etc. You'll have to go all the way there, across that lifeless desert of empty buildings and rude people that won't let you kill and eat them, I died a LOT starving just trying to reach it, why not itinerant sellers or random shops in some ruins?

-Ability to settle. I mean it's a surviving game, greatly done, but you can't make you home anywhere, why not the ability to choose a place to fortify, stock food, make confortable shelter, medical supplies, and (why not) working benches that allows you to fix things, craft more, that require tools to enable some special crafts etc. 

-Definitly more scavenging places, and more specifics ones, like pharmacies, gunshops, supermarkets, factories... We all love those.

-Reinforce the "friendly encounters" potential, right now it's mostly neutral/ennemy, maybe we could meet some people that help us, offer trades, indicate to locations etc.

-The ability to loot money from innocent victi... people i killed in legitimate defense, I mean there is money in the game, how come no one carry any? 

-More weapons and more craftability in weapons, like the ability to upgrade a rifle (kind of like in stalker, i really loved that feature) to make it more deadly. Also the ability to craft bullets would be nice.

-Skill learning, I don't get why there is so much slots available while you can't chose more than 5 to about 8 skills, i get it for the start, but then i'd like to have a way to learn new skills ingame after a while.

-Even biger map. I know this one is huge allready, but in the end there's nothing but one city and the start facility (plus the ruins of course) I'd love to see more special places, more terrains, more climates... more surprises!

-More hunting potential, I managed to kill a dear once, but with no ammunitions and no way to come near them and oneshot them, it's really hard to get any, so the moral choice of rather eating or not human flesh become a rethorical question: you just can't survive without your daily bad mutha's barbecue, I'd like to play it "nice guy" sometime and eat only berries and animal meat, but it need more dears and squirels, and even bunnies, rats, birds etc.. Traps also are underated, we should be able to put one in the forest and come back later to see if it caught something.

-Maps markers, like if i have to drop my loot for some reason, I can mark the place to come back later, this could combine with the previous traps comment to know where you had put a trap, and make you come back to check them before your catch get stolen (by a thief or another animal) or spoils.

-More detailed medicinal interraction: risks of local wound infection (that can turn to septisemia of not cured), specific intervention required (tools needed to pull out an arrow, suturation, hemoragy, broken bones etc.)

-Difficulty choice/save game, as it's pretty frustrating to start all over everytime you die, i'd personnally like to be able to save my games at some points, maybe make it hard like having to find a saving location in the map etc.  An alternative would be to propose 2 game modes: hardcore (permadeath) and softcore (respaw with penalties).

-Zombies, lol joke, the game is allready great, it doesn't even need zombies (i'm not sure some zombie-like creatures would ruin it tho).

That's about all I can think of right now, but anyway the game rocks! I really hope you guys will push it to the best of it's potential, and for the players still hesitating: go for it! It's worth every penny!

9723134.review:
[b]NEO Scavenger is a turn-based survival RPG released by Blue Bottle Games in late 2014. The player roams a post-apocalyptic Michigan, simply trying to survive. The game is tile-based, with a complex combat system that is entirely described through text.  [/b]


The combat system is one that sticks out. It's somewhat reminiscent of the original Wasteland, but instead of a hit point system, damage is actually done to the combantants.The commands are a little more complex than a lot of systems, if you're knocked down, for instance, you can either get up, roll away, or grab the enemy by the ankles and pull 'em down. Most combat is completely optional too, you can sneak away, talk your way out of it, or simply avoid it in general.

Plenty of skills and flaws are selectable from the start, and more skills are able to be obtained later in the game. This encourages trial and error, which is more acceptable in this, considering the survival mechanics, as opposed to a more traditional RPG with cutscenes and dungeons you have to go through in the beginning. Speaking of survival mechanics, they're fantastic; this game is the survival game I've been waiting for. Food and water can be obtained in a myriad of ways. The crafting system is really general, so materials can usually be substituted for others, as opposed to needing very specific things.

The quite clear flaw to all this (at least to some people) is almost unavoidable, and it's that it's not a casual-friendly experience. It's not extremely hard to get into, but a lack of experience and foresight is bound to get you killed on occasion. The randomness of your start also might decide your fate more-so than your skill, depending on the direction you go, but this was either pretty easy to bounce back from, or simply rare.

[list]
[h1]Pros[/h1]
[*]Survival mechanics are pretty lifelike and full of depth.
[*]Combat is complex, and completely option if you decide you don't want to.
[*]Easy to pick up and play, but still a pretty deep and lengthy game if you aren't as bad as I am.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[*]Not casual-friendly, although if you put a little time, thought, and elbow grease in it, you shouldn't have too many problems.
[*]Random map can screw you over early game on occasion. [/list]

[u][b]Final Thoughts[/b]:[/u]
If you like survival games, or late-eighties CRPGs like Wasteland, than you'll find a pretty polished combination that's certain to pull quite a few hours out of you.
[b]Rating:[/b] 9/10

[quote]This review was written for and is published on the [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/24515397] Lit Reviews [LR] curator page. [/url] [/quote]

9693302.review:
This game is like a drug, the well known syndrome of "one more turn". There is always something to discover, something to scare you or something to kill you. After countless deaths by ghosts, dogmen, cannibals and once because of very bad diarrhea, I still come back to the game, trying out different skill combination. The semi-random layout of the map (random scavange locations + fixed special locations), there is always an insentive to explore and see the world. Random encounters make every venture to a city that much more interessting. 
The slow pace of the game is perfect for people who want to take it slow, or like me, need time to actually figure out what they want to do. Combat is also refreshingly slow, gives you time to think over your moves and select the best option at the given moment (will you headbutt your opponent or dodge his next attack, hoping he will be vulnerable to counter attack).
I hope the game evolves in the same way, presenting us with more dangerous creatures that stalk you in the night and more unique places that make you sit for a moment and carefully choose your next action, because permadeath is never that far away.

9690257.review:
I got this game in a humble bundle, which is the only way I would suggest getting it. This is essentially a text-based game. The only way you know things are happening is by reading the log. You have buttons presented to you that are options. When you click the button, the log updates. Nothing else happens on the screen. Even if you win a combat, the only indication is from the combat log.

The graphics are awful. The UI layout is haphazard. There are lots of slots and buttons that make no sense. For example, when you are in your inventory, there is a red X in the upper corner, which usually means "close window", but in this case it does nothing and has hover text that says "Current cursor mode. (1) Take (2) Drop (3) Use." What? I was able to drag a lake and forest around in my area inventory. Why? The game allows you to hang yourself constantly. It never seems to help or guide you to an appropriate choice. For example, it will let you start the game without picking any traits! 

Combat seems to happen randomly, and is a baffling ordeal. If you just click "Confirm" and have no action selected, your enemy will alternate between charging at you, advancing, leaving himself open, etc. No clue what's going on, there. I could never figure out how to eat. When I right clicked on berries in my hand and "used" them, they fell apart in my hand. Huh???

Overall, this game is a complete mess, even if you can get past the crude graphics and terrible UI.

9688586.review:
First off, buy this game. If you haven't already, then you've probably read the reviews and decided that this piece of work is too "brutal" and the RNG will screw you over at every turn. I'm sure you know a lot about how the game is from the store page description and the other reviews, but what I want to address are all of these "LITERALLY DID EVERYTHING TO PREPARE AND EVERY SINGLE GAME I CONSTANTLY DIE INSTANTLY OUT OF NOWHERE! >:(((". 

1. No, you don't step outside of the spawn area and "very commonly" die immediately.

2. This is a roguelike. It's advertised as an extremely difficult roguelike. You may as well go buy Dark Souls and leave an angry review when you die.

3. It's actually quite the challenge to be constantly on the tips of your toes, and if you don't like that, don't buy the game and leave a bitter review.

4. Though the supernatural aspects beg to differ, this game [i] is [/i] trying to offer you the most authentic and realistic experience of surviving in a wasteland. 

5. It's not DayZ. You won't find bandages every corner where you look. You will, however, find enemies that are equally as equipped as you and have the exact same amount of health, strength, and endurance. If you can land a lucky one-shot, so can they.

At this time I wouldn't recommend it. But I'll watch it with interest as development continues.

9682048.review:
I would have enjoyed NEO Scavenger if it didn't "end" so abruptly. There is so much more to want. 

Otherwise, the game is addictive, difficult, and has an dark desolate atmosphere. The first two games of the Fallout series has brought about a morbid curiosity about the surviving in a wasteland for many years. NEO Scanvenger does really well giving a complex some-what realistic survival system. The main things to be concerned about is food, water, shelter, warmth, and health while giving curveballs with dealing with other humans. This game really tests your morality with your drive to survive while requiring you to come up with clever solutions to problems to continue to live. 

I would recomend this game to anyone with interests in survival and adventure.

9682012.review:
One Part Fallout/Wasteland, One Part Text Adventure, One Part Roguelike (or Dark Souls if you're trendy), and One Part Survival/Horror make up this indie game. You wake up in a cryogenic sleep chamber with no clues as to who you are, where you are, or what the hell is going down. All you wake up with is a hospital gown on your back, and a dogmanbeast right down the hall way that looks hungry. 
The game at first is hard as balls as you learn to survive out in the wilderness. Combat is brutal, with the persistent wounds (bleeding, head trauma, cuts/scrapes/scars) that affect your performance. Survival is even worse as you need to juggle hunger, hydration, and health all at once as you travel the wasteland. But after your few first brutal deaths you will eventually start to catch on and make your way further into the harsh post-apocalytpic scenery. Eventually you'll make your way into an actually populated city where the story begins to develop and the game begins to flex its Text Adventure muscles.
NEO Scavenger is EARLY ACCESS as FUCK but shows plenty of potential due to a fairly ugly and not-so-user friendly UI, lack of toturial, and just general lack of polish or explanation for its myriad of features. For hardxcore gamers who aren't afraid of getting their dicks/vaginas handed to them on a bloody platter a few times, or those who are roguelike veterans, pick this up.

9681513.review:
Let's get this out of the way first - This is my first review.

NEO Scavenger has a lot of potential. The gameplay so far is amazing, and the combat and scavenging system works really well, making it all the more impressive. I really can't wait to see the finished product, although there are a few things I want to point out.

The scavenging system is great and all, but it is REALLY brutal unless you get lucky. Probably 8/10 times I played through the game and I died before I survived 1 day. It is really hard to find any kind of clothing even when there is a high loot chance in the scavenging screen.

And when I get to the DMC Gates, as soon as I complete Hatter's request for the Urn, he gives me the pass for the DMC gates, but when I get scanned, it still won't let me in, and as well as that, it breaks after I finished a few turns, even when it's durability is at 100% (even after a few playthroughs this still happened) and I'm not sure if this is a game breaking bug or something is wrong with my NEO Scavenger.

Still, even in Beta and it's well worth the £7 I paid for it. I recommend this HEAVILY to any RPG/Post Apocalyptic players who like any of the original Fallout series - 9/10.

9679759.review:
Do you like an intense game that rewards player skill, encourages thoughful play, and punishes reckless play styles? 
Do you like a game with a broad open world with plenty to explore and do? 
Do you like running screaming from crowbar weilding maniacs?

Well, Neo Scavenger has all of this and more. This game with torture your psyche and leave you begging for more. This game is an intense and brutal introduction to a realistic post social collapse world. A world of monster, and maniacs. This game with piss you off, and bring you to your knees in frustration, and yet, at the same time, leave you cackling maddly after barely skating by in a pitched battle with an all too lucky looter. 

This game will delite and agrivate you in fairly equal parts, and always give you a reason to pick back up and start a new game each time you find your character has once more gotten his skull caved in by one of the many hideous monstrosities in the game. The best part, most of the monsters in this game are flesh and blood humans, not mutants, not zombies, normal humans, driven to the edges of maddness by a cold cruel and uncaring world.

Will this world drive you mad too? 
Are you up to the challenge of the Michigan wilds? 
Can you handle the constant threat of being someone or something else's next meal? 
Can you survive in the brutal world of Neo Scavenger? 
Or will this brutal world swallow you up without so much as a burp, as so many before?

9667222.review: Really great game. VERY addictive, so if you don't have much time to play games this may not be for you. Even in early access this game is very polished and I have yet to encounter a single bug. The choices you make during character creation significantly impact the way you play, and the threat of death from a variety of sources is omnipresent. Although the game is fairly complex, it's also pretty easy to get into because everything works as one would expect it to. For instance, I didn't need a guide or anything to figure out how to craft a campfire on my first attempt. That's not to say this game is easy, far from it: you are pretty much guaranteed to die a few times pretty quickly until you get the hang of things, but deaths in this game don't feel cheap or frustrating and I've never had a death that I didn't learn something from. Pretty much everything in this game is solid; the only thing I could say I want is more content because I have so loved what I have experienced that I want more.

9660943.review:
NEO Scavenger now has my full recommendation.

This game has some deep tactical roots to it. A turned based rogue-like where you start off in the most startling position of weakness I could possibly imagine. “Scavenger” is the name of the game but this key aspect and function serves as a means to an end, and that end is survival. 

You wake up in a cryogenic facility with nothing of use but a hospital gown, medical bracelet. You're soon attacked by a supernatural creature, setting the tone for the brutal reality of survival, which seems to be the biggest note of the game. Notice I didn’t mention any shoes or memories. You’re barefoot and it’s autumn. No way to go through life in my humble opinion. I guess there’s a story about finding your identity or finding out what happened to the world.

Sounds interesting, right? Like “28 Days Later” meets “DayZ”. I couldn’t tell you, because basically I’ve spent my hours just trying to survive against... get ready for it... 

[b]Starvation[/b]. Food is scarce. I once savored a small packet of crackers for sustenance. I recently died trying to hunt a dangerous creature in what felt like a very realistic and thought out exchange in combat.

[b]Hydration[/b]. Water is not as scarce, but takes up storage space and the effects of dehydration can onset quickly leaving you weaker to take on the rigors of survival and ultimately lead to death.

[b]Hypothermia[/b]. It always seems cold and rainy. One play-through I traveled west for 12 hours and died of hypothermia desperately trying to find some degree of shelter or warmth.

[b]Brain damage and severe blood loss[/b]. Some people seem to be opportunists in this new and horrifying setting, attacking you on sight. You can try to reason with them or beat them to death or submission. Either way combat has to be dealt with or avoided one way or another. There are also inhumane beasts, such as the dogman who(that?) recently severed an artery in my leg, taking a fluke victory in what was described to me as brutal combat. 

The turned based combat plays out very interestingly, giving you often unique choices based on your surroundings, tools and skill set. In addition to normal attacks with your weaponry you often have different tactical options in a fight, like a trip or a head-butt. Leaving your opponent stunned and vulnerable is a key to winning conflicts and staying healthy. 

Wounds need attention and in a very animalistic way you need to learn that just because you can best a being in mortal combat it doesn’t necessarily mean he can be your prey.  The spoils of war are all well and good but damn well better be worth the cost of an open wound or wounded limb.
Luckily there seems to be a wide array of technology, pharmaceuticals and med-kits to be found in your mysterious surroundings, everything seems to have something more to it. There's a vast world of crafting, trapping and other skills I've only touched the surface of. Hacking with a laptop can be far more effective than hacking with a cleaver.  

Storage plays as big of a roll as anything I have mentioned thus far. I really enjoy the vast inventory options and the various challenges that arrive. The tools available to you in moving your life supporting cargo are just as varied. Plastic bags can be used as a light and spacious backpack but they quickly deteriorate under such use, a true backpack can handle much more rigors. Sleds can be used to drag your sleeping bag and other supplies but is outclassed by a modified shopping cart as a vehicle.

Light sources can play a big part in safe scavenging, night time or not. Lighters run out of butane though, and flashlights need batteries. You often consume some of your items durability upon use as you scavenge for that rare useful weapon and equally sparse ammunition. 

There are some hiccups in this surprisingly immersive experience, like a lack of a local leaderboard and tracking or rating of your statistics and progress. The game doesn’t seem to integrate with windows well on start-up, but this is easily fixable in the settings. The aural potential of this game seems unrealized and the atmospheric tune that plays throughout doesn’t do enough for me. The lack of sound just about the only thing holding me back from having a more immersed experience.

The slightly crude graphics and the fact that it is a Java game may be off putting to some, but those willing to look past the amateur feel will be rewarded with a view into this game’s deep, brutal, intelligent soul. The sense and reality of a true, terrifying post-apocalyptic survival setting seems fully represented. Made by Blue Bottle Games, which from what I can tell is just one dude, this frisky indie title feels like a true labor of love towards the bleak reality of our impending doom. 

8.5/10

9651656.review: Hoplessly addicted, thats what I am. There are several indie gems out there but I have to admit that this one is the best I've played. Why? Probably because it reminds me so much of the original Wasteland and does well to hold me over till the I get the money for the second. You play as a man with no real memory of who he is and wakes up in a post apocalyptic world, except it doesn't use the cliched desert wasteland or zombie infested urban feista. No, it sets itself apart by creating its own twisted world. In the game you move along a hex map and scavange for supplies. These supplies range from balls of twine and floss to civilian grade weapons and military grade technology. You are able to craft a varity of things out of seemingly usless items. My favorite being the sled (plastic sled + medium length twine, rope, floss, etc.) which allows me to carry more things BUT i am unable to run making combat difficult. Combat takes a bit getting use to but not for very long. It's turn based where you select what you do and you do it then your opponent takes their turn. Simple and when combined with your imagination, downright enjoyable. Even in early acess this game is so well polished I would believe it to be complete, though I'm glade it isn't because I would love to see more and more items and craftable objects. This is a must for fans of classic RPGs, Fallout(original), Wasteland, The Road(both book and movie), and Fallen Paragon(a book I highly recommend find it on Amazon).

9649281.review:
NEO Scavenger is a great Turn-Based Survival Roguelike, where you wake up in a cryobay in Michigan, with no knowledge of how you got there. After a quick encounter with danger, you're thrust into the world with nothing but a hospital gown, bracelet, and an odd talisman around your neck.(do NOT take off the talisman). 

From there you see the hex based map you'll be spending a good time looking at, along with the inventory management screen. From here, you're free to do as you wish, though you're soon given a main objective that you may CHOOSE to do. While there's plenty(a lot) of free roaming options, they also give you a quest, a sort of main story to follow/do if that's what gives you your jolly's.

That, along with the fact you can choose several perks/skills at the beginning can really change how you approach the world.

Do you make a life in the wilderness, using your trapping and knowledge of plants to ensure you thrive where others would struggle?

Do you use your superior stealth and tracking, flitting from ruin to ruin, scavenging what you need, and stealing from bandit camps when you stumble upon them to make your living?

Maybe you can live in or around Detroit, making week-long trips into the wilds and ruins of Michigan, taking items of value to not only equip and feed yourself, but to use your experience as a electrician and mechanic to get the most profit back at the market.

Or maybe you want to use your superior skills in close and/or ranged combat to take down every sumbich' you see and feast upon their flesh?

Or maybe 72 hours in you'll die of diarrhea/dehydration/starvation/cholera because you ate some random berries in the forest, then blow out everything you eat and drink from every orifice. 

Or maybe you'll get jumped and killed by bandits in the middle of the night. 

Perhaps freezing to death because you couldn't find warmth in time tickles your fancy. 

Or maybe die due to infection because you bandaged a wound with a filthy rag.

All these options are available to you. You can even mix and match them. Some of your actions in the world and the skills you take will even influence the main story.

With randomly generated world, permadeath, selection of skills, and randomly placed loot and enemies ensure that no run is ever the same as the last.

9484779.review:
Don't let the boardgame hex look and turn-based gameplay fool you: This is a complex survival simulation, one of the best I've played and almost certainly the best on Steam. Even in early access, the game is in a completely playable and mature state, a notable contrast to the buggy, imbalanced status of almost every game available in this genre.

The drag/drop crafting system is intuitive yet almost too simple, at once the game's greatest asset and biggest barrier to sinking too much time into it. A few minor ease of use tweaks would go a long way. Still, conceptually, this is the kind of system RPGs need to return to, especially outside of the roguelike/survival setting. 

The far less accessible UnReal World is the only game I can think of that compares. This game drops a lot of the old-school roguelike cruft in a positive way (usually that's a bad thing!), so I would honestly recommend this to anybody interested in this sort of game first.

9436673.review:
[h1]Шикарная, атмосферная, затягивающая и по настоящему стоящая своих денег -  NEO Scavenger.[/h1]
Бороздя просторы интернета, я наткнулся на скриншот из этой игры. Один скриншто заставил меня начать искать эту игру на Steam. Когда я нашёл её, сначала колебался, я спрашивал себя: "Стоил ли покупать ранний доступ такой неоднозначной игры?", и решил, для начала, поиграть в [i]демо[/i]. 
Впервые запустив игру, я был в тупике. Непонятным для меня было практически всё. Что за умения? Почему одни красные, а другие синие? Что тут делать? Куда идти? Самым правильным решением такой загвоздки - [b]Изучить сообщество[/b]. Тут то я и попался. Изучив азы, я начал "пробовать игру на вкус". [u]Я ЗАЛИП В ДЕМО, НА ПОЛ ДНЯ[/u]. Очевидно, что после этого я должен был купить эту игру.
Теперь коротко о плюсах этой игры:
+ Пиксельарт графика. Это сугубо субъективный плюс, т.к. мне такое нравится.
+ Постаппокалипсис. Он шикарен и добавляет пару балов к крутости этой игры.
+ Тестовые квесты. В своё время залипал в текстовые квесты Рейнджеров.
+ Ролевая система. Мне понравилось, что каждый параметр твоего персонажа влияет на исход любого действия. Это круто.
+ Выживание. Довольно реалистичное, можно, например, скушать не тех ягодок и умереть через три дня или замёрзнуть до смерти.
Без минусов, к сожалению, не обошлось:
- Только английский язык. Как я писал выше, текста тут много. И он, черт подери, весь на английском языке. Переводчик стал необычайно популярен в этой связи. Надеюсь переведут.
- Единственное сохранение. Если ты умер, то ты умер. Придётся начинать сначала. [spoiler] Но можно накатить сейв менеджер и откатывать[/spoiler]
- Враждебность к новичкам. По началу эту игру легко дропнуть попросту из-за того, что НИЧЕГО НЕ ПОНЯТНО[spoiler] БОЖЕМОЙ ЧТО Я ДЕЛАЮ ЗАЧЕМ КУДА ИДТИ КАКОГО ХЕРА Я УМЕР ОПЯТЬ ЧТО ЗА НАХ ПОШЛО ВСЁ В ЖОПУ[/spoiler]. Но потом привыкаешь. 
[h1] Итог [/h1]
Однозначно нужно брать любителям атмосферных игр, в которые можно надолго залипнуть.  250 рублей не деньги.

Jeu de survie aux détails assez poussés, encore en développement pour le moment.

Le joueur se réveille dans un futur post-apocalyptique et doit trouver de l'équipement pour survire (faim, soif, froid, maladie, survivants, mondtres) tout en essayant de comprendre ce qu'il lui est arrivé.

9403619.review:
Игра заставит вас по-настоящему выживать, потому что враждебно тут буквально всё: Природа, окружающий ландшафт, температура воздуха, всё. Куда бы вы ни пошли, и чем бы не занялись- трудности будут подстерегать вас на каждом шагу. 
Игра незатейлива в плане графики, и в полной мере является лишь текстовой, хоть и с иллюстрациями. Предметов на данном этапе развития игры пока не очень много. Разнообразия не ощущается. Могли хотя бы одних и тех же вещей сделать по несколько вариаций, было бы всяко приятнее. Бой в игре относительно реалистичен, в нём играют роль не только ваши умения, но и опыт боёв в целом, окружающая среда, ваше оружие и некоторая удача, без которой вас могут просто убить за 1 удар. Это я сейчас плавно подошёл к тому, что игре всё-же не хватает немножко баланса. Первое время (а оно, к слову, летит в игре ОЧЕНЬ быстро) вы будете очень довольны игрой, своей хардкорной сложностью она заставит вас играть в неё снова и снова, но потом внезапные смерти начнут вас очень сильно злить, и портить общее впечатление от игры. Шутка ли- экипировать персонажа практически лучшими вещами, что есть в игре, устроить себе ночлег, и без возможности действовать быть убитыми ночью с одной плюхи? Или когда по квесту вам предложат выбрать одну из двух дорог, и выбор неверной сразу же убьёт вашего персонажа, какие бы шмотки\пухи не были бы у вас?... В общем, ребаланс сложности игре не повредит.
К сожалению сюжет детально описать не могу, ибо пройти игру при всём вышеописанном становится почти нереально. (К счастью, "почти"- так что дерзайте)
Как и где-то ранее, я писал что чтобы лучше понять игру- скачайте бесплатную демоверсию в стиме. Не все оценят тонкости пошагового текстового жанра. Но у игры определённо будут свои поклонники.

9323836.review:
Permadeath has never been so fun!

It's so hard to find a good survival game that doesn't feature hordes of the undead - often in place of more creative challenges to, well, staying alive. Similarly, it's the rare title that does anything very well at all for less than $10 these days. NEO Scavenger fits both bills and still has more to come (I guess... I haven't noticed many bugs and I think I've progressed a fair distance). You'll probably need the wiki to help you get started, if only because you have to get the hang of some of the craftable items. I played the demo for about forty-five minutes before grabbing the full version and only had two or three things I'd count as bugs:

1) My save data was inexplicably lost once, but I didn't mind starting over

2) It seems to me that there's really only one way to start with any decent chance but that's not necessarily going to stay true in the final version (and I could be wrong - there's a decent amount of randomness with each play)

3) Sometimes you setup a camp site and it disappears later, sometimes re-appearing on a later visit to that hex

None of these, for me, are game-breakers because I'm not playing NEO Scavenger to win - I'm playing to -survive-. This means battling cold weather, raiders and dogmen, hunger, thirst, fatigue, and the dangers of exploring/scavenging ruined buildings that might collapse on you at any moment. I simply include most of the bugs along with the other dangers and keep on truckin' (or start a new game). I highly recommend that anyone looking to play a game that focuses on those things as NEO Scavenger really does it well. Happy Gaming!
